38 /******************************************************************************/
39 /* REXX Kernel */
40 /* */
41 /* Primitive Activation Class */
42 /* */
43 /* NOTE: activations are an execution time only object. They are never */
44 /* flattened or saved in the image, and hence will never be in old */
45 /* space. Because of this, activations "cheat" and do not use */
46 /* OrefSet to assign values to get better performance. Care must be */
47 /* used to maintain this situation. */
48 /* */

92 static std::atomic<uint32_t> counter(0); // to generate idntfr for concurrency trace
93 
94 uint32_t RexxActivation::getIdntfr()
95 {
96  if (idntfr == 0) idntfr = ++counter;
97  return idntfr;
98 }

100 /**
101  * Create a new activation object
102  *
103  * @param size Base size of the object.
104  *
105  * @return Storage for building an activation object.
106  */
107 void * RexxActivation::operator new(size_t size)
108 {
109  return new_object(size, T_Activation);
110 }

113 /**
114  * Initialize an activation for direct caching in the activation
115  * cache. At this time, this is not an executable activation
116  */
117 RexxActivation::RexxActivation()
118 {
119  setHasNoReferences(); // nothing referenced from this either
120 }
121 
122 
123 /**
124  * Initialize an activation for a method invocation.
125  *
126  * @param _activity The activity we're running under.
127  * @param _method The method being invoked.
128  * @param _code The code to execute.
129  */
130 RexxActivation::RexxActivation(Activity* _activity, MethodClass * _method, RexxCode *_code)
131 {
132  clearObject(); // start with a fresh object
133  activity = _activity; // save the activity pointer
134  scope = _method->getScope(); // save the scope
135  code = _code; // the code we're executing
136  executable = _method; // save this as the base executable
137  // save the source object reference also
138  packageObject = _method->getPackageObject();
139  settings.intermediateTrace = false;
140  activationContext = METHODCALL; // the context is a method call
141  parent = OREF_NULL; // we don't have a parent stack frame when invoked as a method
142  executionState = ACTIVE; // we are now in active execution
143  objectScope = SCOPE_RELEASED; // scope not reserved yet
144 
145  // create a new evaluation stack. This must be done before a
146  // local variable frame is created.
147 
148  // get our evaluation stack
149  allocateStackFrame();
150 
151  // initialize from the package-defined settings
152  inheritPackageSettings();
153 
154  if (_method->isGuarded()) // make sure we set the appropriate guarded state
155  {
156  setGuarded();
157  }
158 
159  settings.parentCode = code;
160 
161  // allocate a frame for the local variables from activity stack
162  allocateLocalVariables();
163 
164  // set the initial and initial alternate address settings
165  settings.currentAddress = activity->getInstance()->getDefaultEnvironment();
166  settings.alternateAddress = settings.currentAddress;
167  // get initial random seed value
168  randomSeed = activity->getRandomSeed();
169  // copy the security manager, and pick up the instance one if nothing is set.
170  settings.securityManager = code->getSecurityManager();
171  if (settings.securityManager == OREF_NULL)
172  {
173  settings.securityManager = activity->getInstanceSecurityManager();
174  }
175  // and the call type is METHOD
176  settings.calltype = GlobalNames::METHOD;
177 }
178 
179 
180 /**
181  * Create a new Rexx activation for an internal level call.
182  * An internal level call is an internal call, a call trap,
183  * an Interpret statement, or a debug pause execution.
184  *
185  * @param _activity The current activity.
186  * @param _parent The parent activation.
187  * @param _code The code to be executed. For interpret and debug pauses, this
188  * is a new code object. For call activations, this is the
189  * parent code object.
190  * @param context The type of call being made.
191  */
192 RexxActivation::RexxActivation(Activity *_activity, RexxActivation *_parent, RexxCode *_code, ActivationContext context)
193 {
194  clearObject(); // start with a fresh object
195  activity = _activity; // save the activity pointer
196  code = _code; // get the code we're going to execute
197 
198  // if this is a debug pause, then flip on the debug pause flag
199  // so we know we're executing the pause, but execute this as an
200  // INTERPRET call.
201  if (context == DEBUGPAUSE)
202  {
203  debugPause = true;
204  context = INTERPRET;
205  }
206 
207  activationContext = context;
208  settings.intermediateTrace = false;
209 
210  // the sender is our parent activity
211  parent = _parent;
212  executionState = ACTIVE; // we are now in active execution
213  objectScope = SCOPE_RELEASED; // internal calls don't have a scope
214 
215  // get our evaluation stack
216  allocateStackFrame();
217 
218  // inherit parents settings
219  _parent->putSettings(settings);
220  // except for INTERPRET, step the trace indentation level for this internal nesting
221  if (!isInterpret())
222  {
223  settings.traceIndent++;
224  }
225 
226  // if we are doing an internal call, we've inherited our
227  // caller's trap state, but if we change anything, then we need
228  // to create a new set of tables so that we don't change the caller's
229  // settings as well.
230  if (context == INTERNALCALL)
231  {
232  settings.setTrapsCopied(false);
233  settings.setReplyIssued(false);
234  // invalidate the timestamp...interpret or debug pauses use the old timestamp.
235  settings.timeStamp.valid = false;
236  }
237 
238  // this is a nested call until we issue a procedure *
239  settings.localVariables.setNested();
240  // get the executable from the parent.
241  executable = _parent->getExecutable();
242  // for internal calls, this is the same source object as the parent
243  if (isInterpret())
244  {
245  // use the source object for the interpret so error tracebacks are correct.
246  packageObject = code->getPackageObject();
247  }
248  else
249  {
250  // save the source object reference also
251  packageObject = executable->getPackageObject();
252  }
253 }
254 
255 
256 /**
257  * Create a top-level activation of Rexx code. This will
258  * either a toplevel program or an external call.
259  *
260  * @param _activity The current thread we're running on.
261  * @param _routine The routine to invoke.
262  * @param _code The code object to be executed.
263  * @param calltype Type type of call being made (function or subroutine)
264  * @param env The default address environment
265  * @param context The type of call context.
266  */
267 RexxActivation::RexxActivation(Activity *_activity, RoutineClass *_routine, RexxCode *_code,
268  RexxString *calltype, RexxString *env, ActivationContext context)
269 {
270  clearObject();
271  activity = _activity;
272  code = _code; // the code comes from the routine object...
273  executable = _routine; // and the routine is our executable
274  // save the source object reference also
275  packageObject = _routine->getPackageObject();
276 
277  activationContext = context;
278  settings.intermediateTrace = false;
279  parent = OREF_NULL; // there's no parent for a top level call
280  executionState = ACTIVE; // we are now in active execution
281  objectScope = SCOPE_RELEASED; // scope not reserved yet
282 
283  // get our evaluation stack
284  allocateStackFrame();
285 
286  // initialize with the package-defined settings
287  inheritPackageSettings();
288 
289  // save the source also
290  settings.parentCode = code;
291 
292  // allocate a frame for the local variables from activity stack
293  allocateLocalVariables();
294 
295  // we use default address settings
296  settings.currentAddress = activity->getInstance()->getDefaultEnvironment();
297  settings.alternateAddress = settings.currentAddress;
298 
299  // this is a top level call, so we get a fresh random seed
300  randomSeed = activity->getRandomSeed();
301 
302  // copy the source security manager
303  settings.securityManager = code->getSecurityManager();
304  // but use the default if not set
305  if (settings.securityManager == OREF_NULL)
306  {
307  settings.securityManager = activity->getInstanceSecurityManager();
308  }
309 
310  // if we have a default environment specified, apply the override.
311  if (env != OREF_NULL)
312  {
313  setDefaultAddress(env);
314  }
315  // set the call type
316  if (calltype != OREF_NULL)
317  {
318  settings.calltype = calltype;
319  }
320 }
321 
322 
323 /**
324  * Generalized object marking.
325  *
326  * @param reason The reason for this live marking operation.
327  */
328 void RexxActivation::live(size_t liveMark)
329 {
330  memory_mark(previous);
331  memory_mark(executable);
332  memory_mark(code);
333  memory_mark(packageObject);
334  memory_mark(scope);
335  memory_mark(receiver);
336  memory_mark(activity);
337  memory_mark(parent);
338  memory_mark(doStack);
339  // settings and stack handle their own marking.
340  settings.live(liveMark);
341  stack.live(liveMark);
342  memory_mark(current);
343  memory_mark(next);
344  memory_mark(result);
345  memory_mark(trapInfo);
346  memory_mark(notifyObject);
347  memory_mark(environmentList);
348  memory_mark(conditionQueue);
349  memory_mark(contextObject);
350 
351  // We're holding a pointer back to our arguments directly where they
352  // are created. Since in some places, this argument list comes
353  // from the C stack, we need to handle the marking ourselves.
354  memory_mark_array(argCount, argList);
355 }
356 
357 
358 /**
359  * Generalized object marking.
360  *
361  * @param reason The reason for this live marking operation.
362  */
363 void RexxActivation::liveGeneral(MarkReason reason)
364 {
365  memory_mark_general(previous);
366  memory_mark_general(executable);
367  memory_mark_general(code);
368  memory_mark_general(packageObject);
369  memory_mark_general(scope);
370  memory_mark_general(receiver);
371  memory_mark_general(activity);
372  memory_mark_general(parent);
373  memory_mark_general(doStack);
374  // settings and stack handle their own marking.
375  settings.liveGeneral(reason);
376  stack.liveGeneral(reason);
377  memory_mark_general(current);
378  memory_mark_general(next);
379  memory_mark_general(result);
380  memory_mark_general(trapInfo);
381  memory_mark_general(notifyObject);
382  memory_mark_general(environmentList);
383  memory_mark_general(conditionQueue);
384  memory_mark_general(contextObject);
385 
386  // We're holding a pointer back to our arguments directly where they
387  // are created. Since in some places, this argument list comes
388  // from the C stack, we need to handle the marking ourselves.
389  memory_mark_general_array(argCount, argList);
390 }

393 /**
394  * Allocate a stack frame for this activation to use
395  * for the evaluation stack.
396  */
397 void RexxActivation::allocateStackFrame()
398 {
399  // a live marking can happen without a properly set up stack (::live()
400  // is called). Setting the NoRefBit when creating the stack avoids it.
401  setHasNoReferences();
402  activity->allocateStackFrame(&stack, code->getMaxStackSize());
403  setHasReferences();
404 }
405 
406 
407 /**
408  * Allocate a new local variable frame.
409  */
410 void RexxActivation::allocateLocalVariables()
411 {
412  // allocate a frame for the local variables from activity stack
413  settings.localVariables.init(this, code->getLocalVariableSize());
414  activity->allocateLocalVariableFrame(&settings.localVariables);
415 }

417 
418 /**
419  * Inherit the settings from our package object.
420  */
421 void RexxActivation::inheritPackageSettings()
422 {
423  // just copy the whole initial settings piece.
424  settings.packageSettings = packageObject->getSettings();
425  // if tracing intermediates, turn on the special fast check flag
426  settings.intermediateTrace = settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.tracingIntermediates();
427 }
428 
429 
430 /**
431  * Re-dispatch an activation after a REPLY
432  *
433  * @return The result object.
434  */
435 RexxObject * RexxActivation::dispatch()
436 {
437  ProtectedObject r;
438  // we just resume running at the old location, reusing the initial values.
439  return run(receiver, settings.messageName, argList, argCount, OREF_NULL, r);
440 }
441 
442 
443 /**
444  * Run some Rexx code...this is it! This is the heart of the
445  * interpreter that makes the whole thing run!
446  *
447  * @param _receiver The target receiver object (if a method call)
448  * @param name The message, routine, or program name.
449  * @param _arglist The argument list.
450  * @param _argcount The count of arguments.
451  * @param start The starting instruction.
452  * @param resultObj A protected object for returning a result.
453  *
454  * @return The execution result (also returned via the protected object.)
455  */
456 RexxObject* RexxActivation::run(RexxObject *_receiver, RexxString *name, RexxObject **_arglist,
457  size_t _argcount, RexxInstruction *start, ProtectedObject &resultObj)
458 {
459  // add the frame to the execution stack
460  RexxActivationFrame frame(activity, this);
461 
462  receiver = _receiver;
463  // the "msgname" can also be the name of an external routine, the label
464  // name of an internal routine.
465  settings.messageName = name;
466 
467  // not a reply restart situation? We need to do the full
468  // initial setup
469  if (executionState != REPLIED)
470  {
471  // the trace entry is allowed if we are at the first instruction
472  traceEntryAllowed = (start == OREF_NULL);
473  traceEntryDone = false;
474 
475  // exits possible? We don't use exits for methods in the image
476  // we try not to check stuff between clauses unless we have to...the
477  // clause boundary flag tells us we need to perform checks.
478  if (!code->isOldSpace() && activity->isClauseExitUsed())
479  {
480  // check at the end of each clause
481  clauseBoundary = true;
482  // remember that we have sys exits
483  settings.setHaveClauseExits(true);
484  }
485  // save the argument information
486  argList = _arglist;
487  argCount = _argcount;
488  // is this the top-level program call? We need to dummy up our
489  // parent information.
490  if (isTopLevelCall())
491  {
492  // save entry argument list forvariable pool fetch private access
493  settings.parentArgList = argList;
494  settings.parentArgCount = argCount;
495  // make sure the code has resolved any class definitions, requires, or libraries
496  code->install(this);
497  // set our starting code position (and the instruction used for error reporting)
498  next = code->getFirstInstruction();
499  current = next;
500  // if this is a program invocation, then we need to potentially
501  // run the initialization exit.
502  if (isProgramLevelCall())
503  {
504  activity->callInitializationExit(this);
505  activity->getInstance()->setupProgram(this);
506  }
507  // this is a method call. We need to do some method setup.
508  else
509  {
510  // guarded methods need to reserve the object scope
511  if (isGuarded())
512  {
513  // get the object variables and reserve these
514  settings.objectVariables = receiver->getObjectVariables(scope);
515 
516  // For proper diagnostic in case of deadlock, do the trace now
517  traceEntry();
518 
519  settings.objectVariables->reserve(activity);
520  objectScope = SCOPE_RESERVED;
521  }
522  // initialize the SELF and SUPER variables
523  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SELF, VARIABLE_SELF, receiver);
524  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SUPER, VARIABLE_SUPER, receiver->superScope(scope));
525  }
526  }
527  // Internal call, interpret, or a debug pause
528  else
529  {
530  // for an internal call, we're handed the starting instruction. This
531  // is probably an interpret, so we need to get it from the code object.
532  if (start != OREF_NULL)
533  {
534  next = start;
535  }
536  else
537  {
538  next = code->getFirstInstruction();
539  }
540  // current and next are always the same at the start in case
541  // we encounter any errors.
542  current = next;
543  }
544  }
545  // resuming on a new thread after a reply
546  else
547  {
548  // the trace entry after the reply will be done only if the trace entry
549  // has been done before the reply
550  traceEntryAllowed = traceEntryDone;
551  traceEntryDone = false;
552 
553  // if we could not keep the guard lock when we were spun off, then
554  // we need to reacquire (and potentially wait) for the lock now.
555  if (settings.hasTransferFailed())
556  {
557  settings.objectVariables->reserve(activity);
558  // turn off the failure flag in case we spin off again.
559  settings.setTransferFailed(false);
560  }
561  }
562 
563  // if this is an internal call, then we need to scan a little
564  // bit ahead to see if we have a procedure at the start of the
565  // code section.
566  if (isInternalCall())
567  {
568  start = next;
569  while (start != OREF_NULL && start->isType(KEYWORD_LABEL))
570  {
571  start = start->nextInstruction;
572  }
573  // if we only have labels and then a PROCEDURE, this is valid
574  // and we allow it when issued.
575  if (start != OREF_NULL && start->isType(KEYWORD_PROCEDURE))
576  {
577  settings.setProcedureValid(true);
578  }
579  }
580 
581  // we are now live
582  executionState = ACTIVE;
583 
584  // we might have a package option that turned on tracing. If this
585  // is a routine or method invocation in one of those packages, give the
586  // initial entry trace so the user knows where we are.
587  // Must be one of ::OPTIONS TRACE ALL/RESULTS/INTERMEDIATES/LABELS
588  traceEntry();
589 
590  // this is the main execution loop...continue until we get a terminating
591  // condition, such as a RETURN or EXIT, or just reaching the end of the code stream.
592  std::exception_ptr ex; // manage delayed exception (see explanation below)
593  while (true)
594  {
595  ex = NULL; // we have no delayed exception yet
596  try
597  {
598  RexxInstruction *nextInst = next;
599  // loop until we no longer have a next instruction to process
600  while (nextInst != OREF_NULL)
601  {
602  // concurrency is cooperative, so we release access every so often
603  // to allow other threads to run.
604  if (++instructionCount > yieldInstructions)
605  {
606  instructionCount = 0; // reset the instruction counter even if we didn't yield.
607  // and have the activity manager decide if we need to give up control
608  ActivityManager::relinquishIfNeeded(activity);
609  }
610  // set the current instruction and prefetch the next one. Control
611  // instructions may change next on us.
612  current = nextInst;
613  next = nextInst->nextInstruction;
614  // execute the current instruction
615  nextInst->execute(this, &stack);
616 
617  // make sure the stack is cleared after each instruction
618  stack.clear();
619  // the time stamp is no longer current
620  settings.timeStamp.valid = false;
621 
622  // do we need to check clauseBoundary stuff? Go do those
623  // checks.
624  if (clauseBoundary)
625  {
626  processClauseBoundary();
627  }
628 
629  // retro-trace of entry in a routine/method is allowed only if
630  // - the TRACE instruction is the first instruction (or the second if the first instruction is an expose).
631  // - the TRACE function is called from the first instruction (or the second if the first instruction is EXPOSE).
632  if (current->getType() != KEYWORD_EXPOSE) traceEntryAllowed = false;
633 
634  // get our next instruction and loop around
635  nextInst = next;
636  }
637 
638  // if we've fallen off the end of the code, our state is still
639  // active. Handle this as an implicit exit
640  if (executionState == ACTIVE)
641  {
642  implicitExit(); /* treat this like an EXIT */
643  }
644 
645  // had a real RETURN?
646  if (executionState == RETURNED)
647  {
648  // perform the normal termination
649  termination();
650  // if this was an interpret, then any state changes need to
651  // be pushed back to the parent
652  if (isInterpret())
653  {
654  // save the nested setting
655  bool nested = parent->settings.localVariables.isNested();
656  // propagate parent's settings back
657  // but keep the parent's message name as is
658  settings.messageName = parent->settings.messageName;
659  parent->getSettings(settings);
660  if (!nested)
661  {
662  // if our calling variable context was not nested, we
663  // need to clear it.
664  parent->settings.localVariables.clearNested();
665  }
666  // merge any pending conditions
667  parent->mergeTraps(conditionQueue);
668  }
669 
670  resultObj = result; // save the result
671  // pop this off of the activity stack and
672  activity->popStackFrame(false);
673  // this stack frame is no longer active. If there is an error
674  // running an uninit method, we want to ensure that this stack
675  // frame doesn't get processed when generating the traceback.
676  frame.disableFrame();
677  // see if there are any objects waiting to run uninits.
678  memoryObject.checkUninitQueue();
679  }
680  // This is a REPLIED state
681  else
682  {
683  // save the reply result for handing back to the caller.
684  resultObj = result;
685 
686  // indicate exit of the activity for the current invocation
687  if (traceEntryDone && tracingLabels() && isMethodOrRoutine())
688  {
689  traceEntryOrExit(TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION_EXIT);
690  if (!tracingAll())
691  {
692  // we pause on the label only for ::OPTIONS TRACE LABELS
693  pauseLabel();
694  }
695  }
696  // reset the next instruction
697  next = current->nextInstruction;
698 
699  // now we need to create a new activity and
700  // attach this activation to it.
701  Activity *oldActivity = activity;
702 
703  activity = oldActivity->spawnReply();
704 
705  // save current frame info in a StringTable as it has caused the creation of a new activity
706  Activity::setCallerStackFrameAsStringTable(oldActivity, activity, false);
707 
708  // save the pointer to the start of our stack frame. We're
709  // going to need to release this after we migrate everything
710  // over.
711  RexxInternalObject **framePtr = stack.getFrame();
712  // migrate the local variables and the expression stack to the
713  // new activity. NOTE: these must be done in this order to
714  // get them allocated from the new activity in the correct
715  // order.
716  stack.migrate(activity);
717  settings.localVariables.migrate(activity);
718  // if we have arguments, we need to migrate those also, as they are
719  // subject to overwriting once we return to the parent activation.
720  if (argCount > 0)
721  {
722  RexxObject **newArguments = (RexxObject **)activity->allocateFrame(argCount);
723  memcpy(newArguments, argList, sizeof(RexxObject *) * argCount);
724  argList = newArguments; // must be set on "this"
725  settings.parentArgList = newArguments;
726  }
727 
728  // return our stack frame space back to the old activity.
729  oldActivity->releaseStackFrame(framePtr);
730 
731  // now push this activation on to the new activity
732  activity->pushStackFrame(this);
733  // pop the old one off of the stack frame (but without returning it to
734  // the activation cache)
735  oldActivity->popStackFrame(true);
736  // if we have the scope lock, try to transfer it to the new activity. If
737  // the lock is nested on this activity, then we will need to
738  // obtain it when we start running on the new thread.
739  if (objectScope == SCOPE_RESERVED)
740  {
741  if (!settings.objectVariables->transfer(activity))
742  {
743  // this will tell us that we need to try grabbing this again.
744  settings.setTransferFailed(true);
745  }
746  }
747  // now start the new activity running and give up control on this
748  // thread before returning.
749  activity->run();
750  oldActivity->relinquish();
751  }
752  return resultObj;
753  }
754  // an error has occurred. The thrown object is an activation pointer,
755  // which tells us when to stop unwinding
756  catch (const RexxActivation *t)
757  {
758  // if we're not the target of this throw, we've already been unwound
759  // keep throwing this until it reaches the target activation.
760  if (t != this)
761  {
762  // due to Windows 64-bit issue https://sourceforge.net/p/oorexx/bugs/1914/
763  // reported to Microsoft and closed as "Not a Bug" in
764  // https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/msconnect-3136060-c-extreme-stack-growth-and-stack/206155
765  // we need to use this workaround instead of a simple "throw"
766  ex = std::current_exception(); // do a "delayed throw"
767  }
768  else
769  {
770  // if we're not the current kernel holder when things return, make sure we
771  // get the lock before we continue
772  if (ActivityManager::currentActivity != activity)
773  {
774  activity->requestAccess();
775  }
776 
777  // unwind the activation stack back to our frame
778  activity->unwindToFrame(this);
779 
780  // do the normal between clause clean up.
781  stack.clear();
782  settings.timeStamp.valid = false;
783 
784  // if we were in a debug pause, we had a error interpreting the
785  // line typed at the pause. We're just going to terminate this
786  // like it was a return
787  if (debugPause)
788  {
789  stopExecution(RETURNED);
790  }
791 
792  // we might have caught a condition. See if we have something to do.
793  if (conditionQueue != OREF_NULL)
794  {
795  // if we have pending traps, process them now
796  if (!conditionQueue->isEmpty())
797  {
798  bool caught = processTraps();
799  // a condition might have raised an error because of a missing label
800  // go process it now
801  if (caught && !conditionQueue->isEmpty())
802  {
803  processTraps();
804  }
805  // processing the traps might have deferred handling until clause
806  // termination (CALL ON conditions)...turn on the clauseBoundary
807  // flag to check for them after instruction completion.
808  if (!conditionQueue->isEmpty())
809  {
810  clauseBoundary = true;
811  }
812  }
813  }
814  }
815  }
816  if (ex) // if we've had a delayed throw, execute it now
817  {
818  std::rethrow_exception(ex);
819  }
820  }
821 }
822 
823 
824 /**
825  * process pending condition traps before going on to execute a
826  * clause
827  *
828  * @return true if a trap handler may have raised another condition.
829  */
830 bool RexxActivation::processTraps()
831 {
832  bool caught = false;
833  size_t i = conditionQueue->items();
834 
835  std::exception_ptr ex; // manage delayed exception (see explanation below)
836  // process each item currently in the queue
837  while (i--)
838  {
839  // get the next handler off the queue
840  TrapHandler *trapHandler = (TrapHandler *)conditionQueue->pull();
841  // condition in DELAY state?
842  if (trapHandler->isDelayed())
843  {
844  // add to the end of the queue
845  conditionQueue->append(trapHandler);
846  }
847  else
848  {
849  // get the condition object from the current trap handler
850  DirectoryClass *conditionObj = trapHandler->getConditionObject();
851  // see if we have something to assign to the RC variable
852  RexxInternalObject *rc = conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RC);
853  if (rc != OREF_NULL)
854  {
855  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::RC, VARIABLE_RC, (RexxObject *)rc);
856  }
857 
858  // it's possible that the condition can raise an error because of a
859  // missing label, so we need to catch any conditions that might be thrown
860  ex = NULL; // we have no delayed exception yet
861  try
862  {
863  // process the trap
864  trapHandler->trap(this);
865  }
866  catch (RexxActivation *t)
867  {
868  caught = true;
869  // if we're not the target of this throw, we've already been unwound
870  // keep throwing this until it reaches the target activation.
871  if (t != this)
872  {
873  // due to Windows 64-bit issue https://sourceforge.net/p/oorexx/bugs/1914/
874  // reported to Microsoft and closed as "Not a Bug" in
875  // https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/msconnect-3136060-c-extreme-stack-growth-and-stack/206155
876  // we need to use this workaround instead of a simple "throw"
877  ex = std::current_exception(); // delay the throw to after the catch block
878  }
879  else
880  {
881  // if we're not the current kernel holder when things return, make sure we
882  // get the lock before we continue
883  if (ActivityManager::currentActivity != activity)
884  {
885  activity->requestAccess();
886  }
887  }
888  }
889  if (ex) // if we've had a delayed throw, execute it now
890  {
891  std::rethrow_exception(ex);
892  }
893  }
894  }
895  return caught;
896 }
897 
898 
899 /**
900  * Process a numeric "debug skip" TRACE instruction to suppress
901  * pauses or tracing for a given number of instructions.
902  *
903  * @param skipCount The number of clauses to skip.
904  */
905 void RexxActivation::debugSkip(wholenumber_t skipCount)
906 {
907  // this is only allowed from a debug pause, not normal code execution
908  if (!debugPause)
909  {
910  reportException(Error_Invalid_trace_debug);
911  }
912 
913  // mark the count to skip
914  settings.traceSkip = std::abs(skipCount);
915  // turn on the skip flag to suppress the tracing.
916  // if the skip count is a negative value, we turn off all
917  // tracing, not just the debug pauses.
918  settings.setTraceSuppressed(skipCount < 0);
919  settings.setDebugBypass(true);
920 }

924  * Generate a string version of the current trace setting.
925  *
926  * @return The current trace setting formatted into a human-readable
927  * string.
928  */
929 RexxString* RexxActivation::traceSetting()
930 {
931  // get this directly from the package settings.
932  return settings.packageSettings.getTrace();
933 }

936 /**
937  * Set the trace using a dynamically evaluated string.
938  *
939  * @param setting The new trace setting.
940  */
941 void RexxActivation::setTrace(RexxString *setting)
942 {
943  TraceSetting newSettings;
944 
945  char traceOption = 0; // a potential bad character
946 
947  if (!newSettings.parseTraceSetting(setting, traceOption))
948  {
949  reportException(Error_Invalid_trace_trace, new_string(&traceOption, 1));
950  }
951  // change the settings to the new value
952  setTrace(newSettings);
953 }
954 
955 
956 /**
957  * Set a new trace setting for the context.
958  *
959  * @param source The trace setting source.
960  */
961 void RexxActivation::setTrace(const TraceSetting &source)
962 {
963  // turn off any trace suppression
964  settings.setTraceSuppressed(false);
965  settings.traceSkip = 0;
966 
967  bool debug = settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.isDebug();
968 
969  // if this is a nop request like "trace ??" our settings remain unchanged.
970  if (source.isNoSetting())
971  {
972  ; // no change
973  }
974  // if this is a trace off request we unconditionally set trace off
975  // no debug is allowed for trace off
976  else if (source.isTraceOff())
977  {
978  settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.setTraceOff();
979  }
980  // this might just be a debug toggle request. All other trace
981  // settings remain the same, but we flip the debug state to the
982  // other mode.
983  else if (source.isDebugToggle())
984  {
985  // except for trace off, we flip the debug state
986  // no debug is allowed for trace off
987  if (!settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.isTraceOff())
988  {
989  settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.toggleDebug();
990  }
991  }
992  else
993  {
994  // set the new flags
995  settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.set(source);
996  // if applicable then trace the entry in the current routine/method
997  traceEntry();
998  }
999 
1000  if (debug && !settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.isDebug())
1001  {
1002  // flipping out of debug mode. Reissue the debug prompt when
1003  // turned back on again
1004  settings.setDebugPromptIssued(false);
1005  }
1006 
1007  // if tracing intermediates, turn on the special fast check flag
1008  settings.intermediateTrace = settings.packageSettings.traceSettings.tracingIntermediates();
1009  // if we issued this from a debug prompt, let the pause handler know this changes.
1010  if (debugPause)
1011  {
1012  settings.setDebugBypass(true);
1013  }
1014 }

1018 /**
1019  * Process a REXX REPLY instruction
1020  *
1021  * @param resultObj The reply result object.
1022  */
1023 void RexxActivation::reply(RexxObject *resultObj)
1024 {
1025  // one reply per activation
1026  if (settings.isReplyIssued())
1027  {
1028  reportException(Error_Execution_reply);
1029  }
1030  settings.setReplyIssued(true);
1031 
1032  // set the state to terminate the main execution loop
1033  stopExecution(REPLIED);
1034  result = resultObj;
1035 }

1037 
1038 /**
1039  * process a REXX RETURN instruction
1040  *
1041  * @param resultObj the return result object.
1042  */
1043 void RexxActivation::returnFrom(RexxObject *resultObj)
1044 {
1045  // already had a reply and trying to return a result? There is nobody
1046  // to receive this result, so this is an error.
1047  if (settings.isReplyIssued() && resultObj != OREF_NULL)
1048  {
1049  reportException(Error_Execution_reply_return);
1050  }
1051  // cause this level to terminate the execution loop and shut down
1052  stopExecution(RETURNED);
1053  // if this is an interpret, we really need to terminate the parent activation
1054  if (isInterpret())
1055  {
1056  parent->returnFrom(resultObj);
1057  }
1058  // normal termination.
1059  else
1060  {
1061  // save the result object
1062  result = resultObj;
1063 
1064  // if this is a top level program, we need to call the termination exit.
1065  if (isProgramLevelCall())
1066  {
1067  activity->callTerminationExit(this);
1068  }
1069  }
1070  // switch debug off to avoid debug pause after an exit or return.
1071  resetDebug();
1072 }
1073 
1074 
1075 /**
1076  * Process a REXX ITERATE instruction
1077  *
1078  * @param name The optional block name for the iterate.
1079  */
1080 void RexxActivation::iterate(RexxString *name)
1081 {
1082  // get the top item off of the block stack
1083  DoBlock *doblock = topBlockInstruction();
1084 
1085  // we might need to scan several levels down to find our target block instruction.
1086  while (doblock != OREF_NULL)
1087  {
1088  // get the actual block instruction (might not be a loop, but it needs to be
1089  // for an iterate
1090  RexxBlockInstruction *loop = doblock->getParent();
1091  // Is this a request to iterate the inner=most loop?
1092  if (name == OREF_NULL)
1093  {
1094  // we only recognize LOOP constructs for this.
1095  if (loop->isLoop())
1096  {
1097  // reset the indentation
1098  setIndent(doblock->getIndent());
1099  // have the loop handle a re-execution. This will
1100  // determine if we continue or terminate.
1101  ((RexxInstructionBaseLoop *)loop)->reExecute(this, &stack, doblock);
1102  return;
1103  }
1104 
1105  }
1106  // a named LEAVE can be either a labeled block or a loop.
1107  else if (loop->isLabel(name))
1108  {
1109  // if we have a name match, but this is not a loop,
1110  // that's a problem.
1111  if (!loop->isLoop())
1112  {
1113  reportException(Error_Invalid_leave_iterate_name, name);
1114  }
1115  // got our target, reset the indent and do the loop.
1116  setIndent(doblock->getIndent());
1117  ((RexxInstructionBaseLoop *)loop)->reExecute(this, &stack, doblock);
1118  return;
1119  }
1120  // terminate this block instruction and step to the
1121  // the next level.
1122  popBlockInstruction();
1123  doblock = topBlockInstruction();
1124  }
1125 
1126  // if we reached here, we either did not find the named
1127  // block or there were no active loops at all.
1128  if (name != OREF_NULL)
1129  {
1130  reportException(Error_Invalid_leave_iteratevar, name);
1131  }
1132  else
1133  {
1134  reportException(Error_Invalid_leave_iterate);
1135  }
1136 }
1137 
1138 
1139 /**
1140  * Process a REXX LEAVE instruction
1141  *
1142  * @param name The potential matching label name (can be null)
1143  */
1144 void RexxActivation::leaveLoop(RexxString *name)
1145 {
1146  // scan the block stack looking for a match.
1147  DoBlock *doblock = topBlockInstruction();
1148 
1149  while (doblock != OREF_NULL)
1150  {
1151  // get the instruction backing the block
1152  RexxBlockInstruction *loop = doblock->getParent();
1153  // no name means leave the innermost block. An unnamed
1154  // LEAVE only works with loops. If this is not a loop,
1155  // keep searching for one.
1156  if (name == OREF_NULL)
1157  {
1158  // we only recognize LOOP constructs for this.
1159  if (loop->isLoop())
1160  {
1161  loop->terminate(this, doblock);
1162  return;
1163  }
1164  }
1165  // a named LEAVE can be either a labeled block or a loop.
1166  else if (loop->isLabel(name))
1167  {
1168  loop->terminate(this, doblock);
1169  return;
1170  }
1171 
1172  // top one is not the one we need...remove this block
1173  // instruction and try the next one.
1174 
1175  popBlockInstruction();
1176  doblock = topBlockInstruction();
1177  }
1178 
1179  // if we get here, we did not find anything to leave. This is either
1180  // a problem with a mismatched name or there was no active loop available to leave.
1181  if (name != OREF_NULL)
1182  {
1183  reportException(Error_Invalid_leave_leavevar, name);
1184  }
1185  else
1186  {
1187  reportException(Error_Invalid_leave_leave);
1188  }
1189 }
1190 
1191 
1192 /**
1193  * Return the line number of the current instruction
1194  *
1195  * @return The line number of the current instruction.
1196  */
1197 size_t RexxActivation::currentLine()
1198 {
1199  // we should have a current instruction. If we don't, just return a
1200  // default of 1.
1201  if (current != OREF_NULL)
1202  {
1203  return current->getLineNumber();
1204  }
1205  else
1206  {
1207  return 1;
1208  }
1209 }

1212 /**
1213  * Execute a procedure expose instruction.
1214  *
1215  * @param variables The list of variables to expose.
1216  * @param count The count of variables to expose.
1217  */
1218 void RexxActivation::procedureExpose(RexxVariableBase **variables, size_t count)
1219 {
1220  // make sure procedure is valid here
1221  if (!settings.isProcedureValid())
1222  {
1223  reportException(Error_Unexpected_procedure_call);
1224  }
1225  // disable further procedure instructions
1226  settings.setProcedureValid(false);
1227 
1228  // allocate a new variable frame for an internal call (we inherited the
1229  // caller's variable frame originally)
1230  activity->allocateLocalVariableFrame(&settings.localVariables);
1231  // make sure we clear out the dictionary, otherwise we'll see the
1232  // dynamic entries from the previous level.
1233  settings.localVariables.procedure(this);
1234 
1235  // now expose each individual variable
1236  for (size_t i = 0; i < count; i++)
1237  {
1238  variables[i]->procedureExpose(this, parent);
1239  }
1240 }

1243 /**
1244  * Expose variables for an EXPOSE instruction
1245  *
1246  * @param variables The list of variables to expose.
1247  * @param count The variable count.
1248  */
1249 void RexxActivation::expose(RexxVariableBase **variables, size_t count)
1250 {
1251  // get the object variables for this object (at the current scope)
1252  VariableDictionary *objectVariables = getObjectVariables();
1253 
1254  // now expose each individual variable
1255  for (size_t i = 0; i < count; i++)
1256  {
1257  variables[i]->expose(this, objectVariables);
1258  }
1259 }

1261 
1262 /**
1263  * Turn on autoexpose as the result of a USE LOCAL instruction.
1264  *
1265  * @param variables The list of variables to declose as local
1266  * variables.
1267  * @param count The variable count.
1268  */
1269 void RexxActivation::autoExpose(RexxVariableBase **variables, size_t count)
1270 {
1271  // we just request the value for each of these variables now, which will
1272  // force them to be created as local variables.
1273  for (size_t i = 0; i < count; i++)
1274  {
1275  variables[i]->getRealValue(this);
1276  }
1277 
1278  // now explicitly make RC, RESULT, SIGL, SELF, and SUPER local
1279  getLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SELF, VARIABLE_SELF);
1280  getLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SUPER, VARIABLE_SUPER);
1281  getLocalVariable(GlobalNames::RC, VARIABLE_RC);
1282  getLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SIGL, VARIABLE_SIGL);
1283  getLocalVariable(GlobalNames::RESULT, VARIABLE_RESULT);
1284 
1285  // now switch modes with the local variables so that every new variable
1286  // is created as an object variable.
1287  settings.localVariables.setAutoExpose(getObjectVariables());
1288 }

1290 
1291 /**
1292  * Process a forward instruction.
1293  *
1294  * @param target The target object.
1295  * @param message The message name.
1296  * @param superClass The superclass override (if any)
1297  * @param arguments The message arguments.
1298  * @param argcount The count of message arguments.
1299  * @param continuing The continue flag.
1300  *
1301  * @return The message result.
1302  */
1303 RexxObject* RexxActivation::forward(RexxObject *target, RexxString *message,
1304  RexxClass *superClass, RexxObject **arguments, size_t argcount, bool continuing)
1305 {
1306  // all pieces that are not specified on the FORWARD will use the
1307  // context values.
1308  if (target == OREF_NULL)
1309  {
1310  target = receiver;
1311  }
1312  if (message == OREF_NULL)
1313  {
1314  message = settings.messageName;
1315  }
1316  if (arguments == OREF_NULL)
1317  {
1318  arguments = argList;
1319  argcount = argCount;
1320  }
1321  // if we are continuing, this is just a message send
1322  if (continuing)
1323  {
1324  ProtectedObject r;
1325  if (superClass == OREF_NULL)
1326  {
1327  target->messageSend(message, arguments, argcount, r);
1328  }
1329  else
1330  {
1331  target->messageSend(message, arguments, argcount, superClass, r);
1332  }
1333  return r;
1334  }
1335  // this activation becomes a phantom, and we issued the
1336  // message as if we don't exist.
1337  else
1338  {
1339  // cannot return a result if a reply has already been issued.
1340  if (settings.isReplyIssued() && result != OREF_NULL)
1341  {
1342  reportException(Error_Execution_reply_exit);
1343  }
1344  // poof, we just became invisible
1345  settings.setForwarded(true);
1346  // we terminate the execution loop for this activation
1347  stopExecution(RETURNED);
1348  // switch off debug for this activation so we don't pause after
1349  // returning from the forward
1350  resetDebug();
1351  ProtectedObject r;
1352  // now issue the message
1353  if (superClass == OREF_NULL)
1354  {
1355  target->messageSend(message, arguments, argcount, r);
1356  }
1357  else
1358  {
1359  target->messageSend(message, arguments, argcount, superClass, r);
1360  }
1361  // set the return value for end-of-activation processing to handle.
1362  result = r;
1363  // terminate this activation
1364  termination();
1365  return OREF_NULL;
1366  }
1367 }
1368 
1369 
1370 /**
1371  * Process a REXX exit instruction
1372  *
1373  * @param resultObj The result object from the exit (optional)
1374  */
1375 void RexxActivation::exitFrom(RexxObject *resultObj)
1376 {
1377  // stop the loop execution
1378  stopExecution(RETURNED);
1379  result = resultObj;
1380  // switch off debug pausing
1381  resetDebug();
1382 
1383  // if we already had a reply issued, we can't return a result on EXIT
1384  if (isTopLevelCall())
1385  {
1386  if (settings.isReplyIssued() && result != OREF_NULL)
1387  {
1388  reportException(Error_Execution_reply_exit);
1389  }
1390 
1391  // run the termination exit if we need to
1392  if (isProgramLevelCall())
1393  {
1394  activity->callTerminationExit(this);
1395  }
1396  }
1397  else
1398  {
1399  // start terminating with this level
1400  RexxActivation *activation = this;
1401  do
1402  {
1403  // terminate this level
1404  activation->termination();
1405  // pop from the activity stack
1406  ActivityManager::currentActivity->popStackFrame(false);
1407  //. go to the next level
1408  activation = ActivityManager::currentActivity->getCurrentRexxFrame();
1409  }
1410  while (!activation->isTopLevel());
1411 
1412  // we are at the main program level, tell it to exit now
1413  activation->exitFrom(resultObj);
1414  throw activation; // throw this as an exception to start the unwinding
1415  }
1416 }
1417 
1418 
1419 /**
1420  * Process a "fall off the end" exit condition
1421  */
1422 void RexxActivation::implicitExit()
1423 {
1424  // at a main program level or completing an INTERPRET instruction?
1425  if (isTopLevelCall() || isInterpret())
1426  {
1427  // real program call? we might have a termination exit to call
1428  if (isProgramLevelCall())
1429  {
1430  activity->callTerminationExit(this);
1431  }
1432  // we are terminating
1433  executionState = RETURNED;
1434  return;
1435  }
1436  // we've had a nested exit, we need to process this more fully
1437  exitFrom(OREF_NULL);
1438 }
1439 
1440 
1441 /**
1442  * do any cleanup due to a program terminating.
1443  */
1444 void RexxActivation::termination()
1445 {
1446  // remove any guard locks for this activity.
1447  guardOff();
1448 
1449  if (traceEntryDone && tracingLabels() && isMethodOrRoutine())
1450  {
1451  if (settings.isForwarded()) // do not trace just as yet
1452  {
1453  settings.setForwarded(false); // clear setting to allow trace on next termination() of this activation
1454  }
1455  else // o.k. to trace
1456  {
1457  traceEntryOrExit(TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION_EXIT);
1458  if (!tracingAll())
1459  {
1460  // we pause on the label only for ::OPTIONS TRACE LABELS
1461  pauseLabel();
1462  }
1463  }
1464  }
1465 
1466  // have any setlocals we need to undo?
1467  if (environmentList != OREF_NULL && !environmentList->isEmpty())
1468  {
1469  // restore the environment to the first version.
1470  SystemInterpreter::restoreEnvironment(((BufferClass *)environmentList->getLastItem())->getData());
1471  }
1472 
1473  environmentList = OREF_NULL;
1474  // close any open streams
1475  closeStreams();
1476 
1477  // release the stack frame, which also releases the frame for the variable cache
1478  activity->releaseStackFrame(stack.getFrame());
1479  // do the variable termination
1480  cleanupLocalVariables();
1481  // deactivate the context object if we created one.
1482  if (contextObject != OREF_NULL)
1483  {
1484  contextObject->detach();
1485  }
1486  // since we don't always control the order of garbage collection and the
1487  // argument list source, clear the arglist pointers as a belt-and-braces
1488  // situation.
1489  argList = OREF_NULL;
1490  argCount = 0;
1491 }
1492 
1493 
1494 /**
1495  * Create/copy a trap table as needed
1496  */
1497 void RexxActivation::checkTrapTable()
1498 {
1499  // no trap table created yet? just create a new collection
1500  if (settings.traps == OREF_NULL)
1501  {
1502  settings.traps = new_string_table();
1503  }
1504  // have to copy the trap table for an internal routine call?
1505  else if (isInternalCall() && !settings.areTrapsCopied())
1506  {
1507  // copy the table and remember that we've done that
1508  settings.traps = (StringTable *)settings.traps->copy();
1509  settings.setTrapsCopied(true);
1510  }
1511 }
1512 
1513 
1514 /**
1515  * Activate a condition trap.
1516  *
1517  * @param condition The condition name being trapped.
1518  * @param handler The instruction handling the trap.
1519  */
1520 void RexxActivation::trapOn(RexxString *condition, RexxInstructionTrapBase *handler, bool signal)
1521 {
1522  // make sure we have a trap table (we create on demand)
1523  checkTrapTable();
1524 
1525  // add a state block to our current trap list
1526  settings.traps->put(new TrapHandler(condition, handler), condition);
1527  // if this is NOVALUE or ANY, then we need to flip on the switch in the
1528  // local variables indicating we're interested in NOVALUE events.
1529  // (we only need to check this for SIGNAL, not for CALL)
1530  if (signal && (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOVALUE) || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::ANY)))
1531  {
1532  settings.localVariables.setNovalueOn();
1533  // we also need to disable the novalue error setting from ::OPTIONS in order for the
1534  // events to be raised.
1535  disableNovalueSyntax();
1536  }
1537  // we also disable an OPTIONS condition SYNTAX that we may have
1538  bool conditionIsAny = condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::ANY);
1539  if (isErrorSyntaxEnabled() &&
1540  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::ERRORNAME)))
1541  {
1542  disableErrorSyntax();
1543  }
1544  if (isFailureSyntaxEnabled() &&
1545  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::FAILURE)))
1546  {
1547  disableFailureSyntax();
1548  }
1549  if (signal && isLostdigitsSyntaxEnabled() &&
1550  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::LOSTDIGITS)))
1551  {
1552  disableLostdigitsSyntax();
1553  }
1554  if (signal && isNostringSyntaxEnabled() &&
1555  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOSTRING)))
1556  {
1557  disableNostringSyntax();
1558  }
1559  if (isNotreadySyntaxEnabled() &&
1560  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOTREADY)))
1561  {
1562  disableNotreadySyntax();
1563  }
1564 }
1565 
1566 
1567 /**
1568  * Disable a condition trap
1569  *
1570  * @param condition The name of the condition we're turning off.
1571  */
1572 void RexxActivation::trapOff(RexxString *condition, bool signal)
1573 {
1574  checkTrapTable();
1575 
1576  // remove our existing trap.
1577  settings.traps->remove(condition);
1578  // if we no longer have NOVALUE or ANY enabled, then we can turn
1579  // off novalue processing in the variable pool
1580  // (we only need to check this for SIGNAL, not for CALL)
1581  bool conditionIsAny = condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::ANY);
1582  if (signal &&
1583  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOVALUE)) &&
1584  !settings.traps->hasIndex(GlobalNames::NOVALUE) && !settings.traps->hasIndex(GlobalNames::ANY))
1585  {
1586  settings.localVariables.setNovalueOff();
1587  // we also need to disable the novalue error setting from ::OPTIONS in order to restore
1588  // the real default behavior.
1589  disableNovalueSyntax();
1590  }
1591 
1592  // we also disable an OPTIONS condition SYNTAX that we may have
1593  if (isErrorSyntaxEnabled() &&
1594  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::ERRORNAME)))
1595  {
1596  disableErrorSyntax();
1597  }
1598  if (isFailureSyntaxEnabled() &&
1599  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::FAILURE)))
1600  {
1601  disableFailureSyntax();
1602  }
1603  if (signal && isLostdigitsSyntaxEnabled() &&
1604  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::LOSTDIGITS)))
1605  {
1606  disableLostdigitsSyntax();
1607  }
1608  if (signal && isNostringSyntaxEnabled() &&
1609  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOSTRING)))
1610  {
1611  disableNostringSyntax();
1612  }
1613  if (isNotreadySyntaxEnabled() &&
1614  (conditionIsAny || condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOTREADY)))
1615  {
1616  disableNotreadySyntax();
1617  }
1618 }

1634  // copy the table and remember that we've done that

1636  settings.setIOConfigCopied(true);
1637  }

1687 RexxActivation* RexxActivation::external()

1690  if (isInternalLevelCall())

1693  }
1694  // got the one we need
1695  else

1701 
1702 /**
1703  * Raise a condition using exit semantics for the returned value.
1704  *
1705  * @param condition The condition to raise.
1706  * @param rc The RC value for the condition.
1707  * @param description
1708  * The condition description
1709  * @param additional The addtional information for the condition.
1710  * @param resultObj The result object.
1711  * @param conditionobj
1712  * Any propagated condition object.
1713  */
1714 void RexxActivation::raiseExit(RexxString *condition, RexxObject *rc, RexxString *description,
1715  RexxObject *additional, RexxObject *resultObj, DirectoryClass *conditionobj)
1716 {
1717  // if we are a top level activation already, just do the raise part now.
1718  if (isTopLevelCall())
1719  {
1720  raise(condition, rc, description, additional, resultObj, conditionobj);
1721  return;
1722  }
1723 
1724  // are we at the top level? This is basically an
1725  // exit instruction because there's nobody able to handle this.
1726  if (parent == OREF_NULL)
1727  {
1728  exitFrom(resultObj);
1729  }
1730  else
1731  {
1732  // if we're the top level of the program, run the termination exit
1733  if (isProgramLevelCall())
1734  {
1735  activity->callTerminationExit(this);
1736  }
1737  ProtectedObject p(this);
1738  // terminate the activation and remove from the stack
1739  termination();
1740  activity->popStackFrame(false);
1741  // propagate to the parent
1742  parent->raiseExit(condition, rc, description, additional, resultObj, conditionobj);
1743  }
1744 }
1745 
1746 
1747 /**
1748  * Raise a condition in the context.
1749  *
1750  * @param condition the condition name,
1751  * @param rc The rc value for the condition.
1752  * @param description
1753  * The condition description.
1754  * @param additional any condition additional information.
1755  * @param resultObj The result object associated with the raise.
1756  * @param conditionobj
1757  * The condition object used for a propagate.
1758  */
1759 void RexxActivation::raise(RexxString *condition, RexxObject *rc, RexxString *description,
1760  RexxObject *additional, RexxObject *resultObj, DirectoryClass *conditionobj)
1761 {
1762  bool propagated = false;
1763 
1764  Protected<DirectoryClass> p = conditionobj;
1765 
1766  // are we propagating an existing condition?
1767  if (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::PROPAGATE))
1768  {
1769  // get the original condition name
1770  condition = (RexxString *)conditionobj->get(GlobalNames::CONDITION);
1771  propagated = true;
1772  // fill in the propagation status
1773  conditionobj->put(TheTrueObject, GlobalNames::PROPAGATED);
1774  // if no result was specified, use the one from the condition object
1775  if (resultObj == OREF_NULL)
1776  {
1777  resultObj = (RexxObject *)conditionobj->get(GlobalNames::RESULT);
1778  }
1779  // now fill in other pieces from the raise instruction /
1780  if (rc != OREF_NULL)
1781  {
1782  conditionobj->put(rc, GlobalNames::RC);
1783  }
1784  if (description != OREF_NULL)
1785  {
1786  conditionobj->put(description, GlobalNames::DESCRIPTION);
1787  }
1788  if (additional != OREF_NULL)
1789  {
1790  conditionobj->put(additional, GlobalNames::ADDITIONAL);
1791  }
1792  if (resultObj != OREF_NULL)
1793  {
1794  conditionobj->put(resultObj, GlobalNames::RESULT);
1795  }
1796  }
1797  else
1798  {
1799  // build a condition object for the condition
1800  p = activity->createConditionObject(condition, rc, description, additional, result);
1801 
1802  conditionobj = p;
1803  conditionobj->put(TheFalseObject, GlobalNames::PROPAGATED);
1804  // not propagated
1805  propagated = false;
1806  }
1807 
1808  // is this a SYNTAX error? These get special handling
1809  if (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::SYNTAX))
1810  {
1811  // if propagating, terminate this level and reraise the condition
1812  // with earlier levels.
1813  if (propagated)
1814  {
1815  // protect this activation after we get popped from the stack
1816  ProtectedObject p(this);
1817  termination();
1818  activity->popStackFrame(false);
1819  ActivityManager::currentActivity->reraiseException(conditionobj);
1820  }
1821  else
1822  {
1823  // raise the error now at this level.
1824  ActivityManager::currentActivity->raiseException((RexxErrorCodes)((RexxInteger *)rc)->getValue(), description, (ArrayClass *)additional, resultObj);
1825  }
1826  }
1827  else
1828  {
1829  // find a predecessor Rexx activation
1830  ActivationBase *_sender = senderActivation(condition);
1831  // see if the sender level is trapping this condition
1832  bool trapped = false;
1833  if (_sender != OREF_NULL)
1834  {
1835  trapped = _sender->trap(condition, conditionobj);
1836  }
1837 
1838  // If this was untrapped and either a HALT or a NOMETHOD condition, then we need to raise an error
1839  if (!trapped)
1840  {
1841  if (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::HALT))
1842  {
1843  reportException(Error_Program_interrupted_condition, GlobalNames::HALT);
1844  }
1845  // untrapped NOMETHOD conditions are also defined as giving an error. This is a little
1846  // trickier because the normal NOMETHOD error message includes both the receive and the message
1847  // name. If we have enough additional information for the full message, we'll use that, otherwise
1848  // we'll use a generic message that doesn't require substitutions.
1849  else if (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::NOMETHOD))
1850  {
1851  // this might be a propagate, in which case additional and description might not be
1852  // set. Pull the current from the condition object.
1853  additional = (RexxObject *)conditionobj->get(GlobalNames::ADDITIONAL);
1854  description = (RexxString *)conditionobj->get(GlobalNames::DESCRIPTION);
1855 
1856  // this is a CONDITION, not a syntax error at this point. The ADDITIONAL information
1857  // is the receiver object, the message name is the description
1858  if (additional != OREF_NULL && description != OREF_NULL)
1859  {
1860  reportException(Error_No_method_name, additional, description);
1861  }
1862 
1863  // if the error was not issued above, we fall through to here
1864  reportException(Error_No_method_unhandled);
1865  }
1866  }
1867 
1868  // process the return part, then unwind the call stack
1869  returnFrom(resultObj);
1870  throw this;
1871  }
1872 }
1873 
1874 
1875 /**
1876  * Return the object variables dictionary for the current
1877  * scope level.
1878  *
1879  * @return the target object variables.
1880  */
1881 VariableDictionary* RexxActivation::getObjectVariables()
1882 {
1883  // not retrieved yet? We need the dictionary from the current method scope.
1884  if (settings.objectVariables == OREF_NULL)
1885  {
1886  settings.objectVariables = receiver->getObjectVariables(scope);
1887  // are we a guarded method? Get the guard lock now.
1888  if (isGuarded())
1889  {
1890  settings.objectVariables->reserve(activity);
1891  objectScope = SCOPE_RESERVED;
1892  }
1893  }
1894  return settings.objectVariables;
1895 }

1897 
1898 /**
1899  * Resolve a stream name for a BIF call.
1900  *
1901  * @param name The name of the stream.
1902  * @param stack The expression stack.
1903  * @param input The input/output flag.
1904  * @param fullName The returned full name of the stream.
1905  * @param added A flag indicating we added this. Set this
1906  * pointer to NULL for a lookup without adding
1907  * to the stream table.
1908  *
1909  * @return The backing stream object for the name.
1910  */
1911 RexxObject* RexxActivation::resolveStream(RexxString *name, bool input, Protected<RexxString> &fullName, bool *added)
1912 {
1913  bool newName = true;
1914  bool addName = false;
1915  // if the file system is NOT case sensitive, remember the qualified name
1916  StringTable *fileNames;
1917  // when the caller requires a stream table entry, then set the initial indicator.
1918  if (added != NULL)
1919  {
1920  *added = false;
1921  }
1922  StringTable *streamTable = getStreams();
1923  // the default full name is the initial one
1924  fullName = name;
1925  // if length of name is 0, then it's the same as omitted. This is
1926  // a request for either the default input or output stream. The flag
1927  // tells us which one.
1928  if (name == OREF_NULL || name->getLength() == 0)
1929  {
1930  if (input)
1931  {
1932  return getLocalEnvironment(GlobalNames::INPUT);
1933  }
1934  else
1935  {
1936  return getLocalEnvironment(GlobalNames::OUTPUT);
1937  }
1938  }
1939  // check for the standard input or out put streams.
1940  else if (name->strCaselessCompare("STDIN") || name->strCaselessCompare("STDIN:"))
1941  {
1942  return getLocalEnvironment(GlobalNames::INPUT);
1943  }
1944  else if (name->strCaselessCompare("STDOUT") || name->strCaselessCompare("STDOUT:"))
1945  {
1946  return getLocalEnvironment(GlobalNames::OUTPUT);
1947  }
1948  else if (name->strCaselessCompare("STDERR") || name->strCaselessCompare("STDERR:"))
1949  {
1950  return getLocalEnvironment(GlobalNames::ERRORNAME);
1951  }
1952  // not one of the standards...go looking for a file.
1953  else
1954  {
1955  RexxString *qualifiedName;
1956  if (notCaseSensitive()) // probably Windows
1957  {
1958  fileNames = getFileNames();
1959  qualifiedName = (RexxString *)fileNames->get(name);
1960  if (qualifiedName != OREF_NULL) // we have seen this name before
1961  {
1962  fullName = qualifiedName;
1963  newName = false; // don't redo the system calls
1964  }
1965  else
1966  {
1967  // add to fileNames only if the stream is going to be added
1968  addName = (added != NULL);
1969  }
1970 
1971  }
1972  if (newName)
1973  {
1974  // get the fully qualified name
1975  qualifiedName = Interpreter::qualifyFileSystemName(name);
1976  fullName = qualifiedName;
1977  }
1978  if (addName)
1979  {
1980  // add the name to the fileNames table for future requests
1981  fileNames->put(qualifiedName, name);
1982  }
1983  // see if we have this in the table already. If not opened yet, we need
1984  // to try to open it.
1985  RexxObject *stream = (RexxObject *)streamTable->get(qualifiedName);
1986  if (stream == OREF_NULL)
1987  {
1988  // do the security manager check first.
1989  SecurityManager *manager = getEffectiveSecurityManager();
1990  stream = manager->checkStreamAccess(qualifiedName);
1991  if (stream != OREF_NULL)
1992  {
1993  streamTable->put(stream, qualifiedName);
1994  return stream;
1995  }
1996  // create an instance of the stream class and create a new
1997  // instance
1998  RexxObject *t = OREF_NULL; // required for the findClass call
1999  RexxClass *streamClass = TheRexxPackage->findClass(GlobalNames::STREAM, t);
2000 
2001 
2002  ProtectedObject result;
2003  stream = streamClass->sendMessage(GlobalNames::NEW, name, result);
2004 
2005  // if we're requested to add this to the table, add it in and return the indicator.
2006  if (added != NULL)
2007  {
2008  streamTable->put(stream, qualifiedName);
2009  *added = true;
2010  }
2011  }
2012  return stream;
2013  }
2014 }
2015 
2016 
2017 /**
2018  * Return the associated object variables stream table
2019  *
2020  * @return The table of opened streams.
2021  */
2022 StringTable* RexxActivation::getStreams()
2023 {
2024  // first request for a stream object? We need to
2025  // create the table.
2026  if (settings.streams == OREF_NULL)
2027  {
2028  // if we are a top-level program or a method call,
2029  // we just set a new directory. NOTE: For legacy reasons,
2030  // external routine calls need to inherit the table
2031  // from the main program context, so this is not a
2032  // isTopLevelCall() test.
2033  if (isProgramOrMethod())
2034  {
2035  settings.streams = new_string_table();
2036  }
2037  else
2038  {
2039  // get the caller frame. If it is not a Rexx one, then
2040  // we use a fresh stream table
2041  ActivationBase *callerFrame = getPreviousStackFrame();
2042  if (callerFrame == OREF_NULL || !callerFrame->isRexxContext())
2043  {
2044  settings.streams = new_string_table();
2045  }
2046  else
2047  {
2048 
2049  // always use caller's for internal call, external call or interpret
2050  settings.streams = ((RexxActivation *)callerFrame)->getStreams();
2051  }
2052  }
2053  // determine if the file system is case insensitive or not and save it
2054  settings.caseInsensitive = !SysFileSystem::isCaseSensitive();
2055  }
2056  return settings.streams;
2057 }

2060 /**
2061  * Signal to a target instruction
2062  *
2063  * @param target The target of the signal instruction.
2064  */
2065 void RexxActivation::signalTo(RexxInstruction *target)
2066 {
2067  // if this is an interpret or debug pause, we need to shut this
2068  // activation down and have the parent execute the signal.
2069  if (isInterpret())
2070  {
2071  stopExecution(RETURNED);
2072  parent->signalTo(target);
2073  }
2074  // need to clean up some things in a SIGNAL. Start with
2075  // setting the SIGL variable to the current linenumber, then
2076  // clear out all of our block instruction states
2077  else
2078  {
2079  size_t lineNum = current->getLineNumber();
2080  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SIGL, VARIABLE_SIGL, new_integer(lineNum));
2081  // the target is the next instruction we execute.
2082  next = target;
2083  doStack = OREF_NULL;
2084  blockNest = 0;
2085  settings.traceIndent = 0;
2086  }
2087 }

2093 void RexxActivation::toggleAddress()

2095  RexxString *temp = settings.currentAddress;
2096  settings.currentAddress = settings.alternateAddress;
2097  settings.alternateAddress = temp;
2098 }

2113  // environment

2115  {

2118  }
2119 }

2135 /**
2136  * Signal to a computed label target
2137  *
2138  * @param name The computed string name.
2139  */
2140 void RexxActivation::signalValue(RexxString *name)
2141 {
2142  RexxInstruction *target = OREF_NULL;
2143  // get the label table from the current code context.
2144  // we might not have any labels in the code, so
2145  // only perform the lookup if the table is there.
2146 
2147  StringTable *labels = getLabels();
2148  if (labels != OREF_NULL)
2149  {
2150  target = (RexxInstruction *)labels->get(name);
2151  }
2152 
2153  // no table or an unknown label? Raise the error now.
2154  if (target == OREF_NULL)
2155  {
2156  reportException(Error_Label_not_found_name, name);
2157  }
2158  // continue processing like a normal signal instruction.
2159  signalTo(target);
2160 }
2161 
2162 
2163 /**
2164  * Turn on the activation guarded state
2165  */
2166 void RexxActivation::guardOn()
2167 {
2168  // a guard on request while already guarded is a nop.
2169  if (objectScope == SCOPE_RELEASED)
2170  {
2171  // first access to the scope object variables? Go get the variables.
2172  if (settings.objectVariables == OREF_NULL)
2173  {
2174  settings.objectVariables = receiver->getObjectVariables(scope);
2175  }
2176  // now lock the dictionary and flip our state.
2177  settings.objectVariables->reserve(activity);
2178  objectScope = SCOPE_RESERVED;
2179  }
2180 }

2406 
2407 /**
2408  * Check the activation to see if this is trapping a condition.
2409  * For SIGNAL traps, control goes back to the point of the trap
2410  * via throw. For CALL ON traps, the condition is saved, and
2411  * the method returns true to indicate the trap was handled.
2412  *
2413  * @param condition The name of the raised condition.
2414  * @param exceptionObject
2415  * The exception object associated with the condition.
2416  *
2417  * @return true if the condition was trapped and handled, false otherwise.
2418  */
2419 bool RexxActivation::trap(RexxString *condition, DirectoryClass *exceptionObject)
2420 {
2421  // if we're in the act of processing a FORWARD instruction, then this
2422  // stack frame doesn't really exist any more. We need to check the previous
2423  // stack frame to see if it can handle this.
2424  if (settings.isForwarded())
2425  {
2426  ActivationBase *activation = getPreviousStackFrame();
2427  // we can have multiple forwardings in process, so keep drilling until we
2428  // find a non-forwarded frame
2429  while (activation != OREF_NULL && isOfClass(Activation, activation))
2430  {
2431  // we've found a non-ghost frame, so have it try to handle this.
2432  if (!activation->isForwarded())
2433  {
2434  return activation->trap(condition, exceptionObject);
2435  }
2436  activation = activation->getPreviousStackFrame();
2437  }
2438  // we are not really here, so we can't handle this
2439  return false;
2440  }
2441  // do we need to notify a message object of a syntax error?
2442  // send it the notification message.
2443  if (notifyObject != OREF_NULL && condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::SYNTAX))
2444  {
2445  notifyObject->error(exceptionObject);
2446  }
2447 
2448  // are we in a debug pause? ignore any condition other than a syntax error.
2449  if (debugPause)
2450  {
2451  if (!condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::SYNTAX))
2452  {
2453  return false;
2454  }
2455  // display the errors encountered during debug, then do the
2456  // error unwind to terminate the debug pause activation.
2457  activity->displayDebug(exceptionObject);
2458  throw this;
2459  }
2460  // no trap table set yet? can't handle this
2461  if (settings.traps == OREF_NULL)
2462  {
2463  return false;
2464  }
2465 
2466  // see if we have a handler for this condition
2467  TrapHandler *trapHandler = (TrapHandler *)settings.traps->get(condition);
2468 
2469  // nothing there for the specific condition. We could have an ANY
2470  // trap enabled, so check that.
2471  if (trapHandler == OREF_NULL)
2472  {
2473 
2474  trapHandler = (TrapHandler *)settings.traps->get(GlobalNames::ANY);
2475  // if we have a handler, but this can't handle this can condition, return false
2476  if (trapHandler != OREF_NULL && !trapHandler->canHandle(condition))
2477  {
2478  return false;
2479  }
2480  }
2481  // if the condition is being trapped, do the CALL or SIGNAL
2482  if (trapHandler != OREF_NULL)
2483  {
2484  // if this is a halt condition, we might need to call the system exit.
2485  if (condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::HALT))
2486  {
2487  activity->callHaltClearExit(this);
2488  }
2489 
2490  // create a pending queue if we don't have one yet
2491  if (conditionQueue == OREF_NULL)
2492  {
2493  conditionQueue = new_queue();
2494  }
2495 
2496  // add the instruction trap info
2497  exceptionObject->put(trapHandler->instructionName(), GlobalNames::INSTRUCTION);
2498  // set the condition object into the traphandler
2499  trapHandler->setConditionObject(exceptionObject);
2500  // add the handler to the condition queue
2501  conditionQueue->append(trapHandler);
2502  // clear this from the activity if we're trapping this here
2503  activity->clearCurrentCondition();
2504 
2505  // if the handler is a SIGNAL, then we unwind everything now without returning
2506  if (trapHandler->isSignal())
2507  {
2508  // if not an interpret, then we can just throw this and unwind the
2509  // stack.
2510  if (!isInterpret())
2511  {
2512  throw this;
2513  }
2514  // if we're interpreted, this needs to be handled in the parent
2515  // activation.
2516  else
2517  {
2518  parent->mergeTraps(conditionQueue);
2519  parent->unwindTrap(this);
2520  }
2521  }
2522  else
2523  {
2524  // we're going to need to process this trap at the clause boundary.
2525  clauseBoundary = true;
2526  // we've handled this
2527  return true;
2528  }
2529  }
2530  // not something we can handle.
2531  return false;
2532 }
2533 
2534 
2535 /**
2536  * Check the activation to see if this is trapping a condition.
2537  * This does not process the trap, but merely indicates that
2538  * this activation WILL trap the condition. This is a
2539  * preliminary check that allows a condition to be raised
2540  * without having to construct a condition object first. This
2541  * can be critical for conditions that are not normally trapped,
2542  * like NOSTRING or LOSTDIGITS.
2543  *
2544  * @param condition The name of the raised condition.
2545  * @param exceptionObject
2546  * The exception object associated with the condition.
2547  *
2548  * @return true if the condition was trapped and handled, false otherwise.
2549  */
2550 bool RexxActivation::willTrap(RexxString *condition)
2551 {
2552  // if we're in the act of processing a FORWARD instruction, then this
2553  // stack frame doesn't really exist any more. We need to check the previous
2554  // stack frame to see if it can handle this.
2555  if (settings.isForwarded())
2556  {
2557  ActivationBase *activation = getPreviousStackFrame();
2558  // we can have multiple forwardings in process, so keep drilling until we
2559  // find a non-forwarded frame
2560  while (activation != OREF_NULL && isOfClass(Activation, activation))
2561  {
2562  // we've found a non-ghost frame, so have it try to handle this.
2563  if (!activation->isForwarded())
2564  {
2565  return activation->willTrap(condition);
2566  }
2567  activation = activation->getPreviousStackFrame();
2568  }
2569  // we are not really here, so we can't handle this
2570  return false;
2571  }
2572 
2573  // are we in a debug pause? ignore any condition other than a syntax error.
2574  if (debugPause)
2575  {
2576  if (!condition->strCompare(GlobalNames::SYNTAX))
2577  {
2578  return false;
2579  }
2580  return true;
2581  }
2582 
2583  // no trap table set yet? can't handle this
2584  if (settings.traps == OREF_NULL)
2585  {
2586  return false;
2587  }
2588 
2589  // see if we have a handler for this condition
2590  TrapHandler *trapHandler = (TrapHandler *)settings.traps->get(condition);
2591 
2592  // if we are trapping this specifically, let the caller know.
2593  if (trapHandler != OREF_NULL)
2594  {
2595  return true;
2596  }
2597 
2598  // now try for an ANY trap
2599  trapHandler = (TrapHandler *)settings.traps->get(GlobalNames::ANY);
2600  // if we have a handler, but this can't handle this can condition, return false
2601  if (trapHandler != OREF_NULL)
2602  {
2603  return trapHandler->canHandle(condition);
2604  }
2605  // no handler, return false
2606  return false;
2607 }
2608 
2609 
2610 /**
2611  * Process a NOVALUE event for a variable.
2612  *
2613  * @param name The variable name triggering the event.
2614  * @param variable The resolved variable object for the variable.
2615  *
2616  * @return A value for that variable.
2617  */
2618 RexxObject* RexxActivation::handleNovalueEvent(RexxString *name, RexxObject *defaultValue, RexxVariable *variable)
2619 {
2620  // have we specified via ::options that errors should be raised?
2621  if (isNovalueSyntaxEnabled())
2622  {
2623  reportException(Error_Execution_unassigned_variable, name);
2624  }
2625 
2626  RexxObject *value = novalueHandler(name);
2627  // If the handler returns anything other than .nil, this is a
2628  // value
2629  if (value != TheNilObject)
2630  {
2631  return value;
2632  }
2633  // give any external novalue handler a chance at this
2634  if (!activity->callNovalueExit(this, name, value))
2635  {
2636  // set this variable to the object found in the engine
2637  variable->set(value);
2638  return value;
2639  }
2640  // raise novalue?
2641  if (novalueEnabled())
2642  {
2643  reportNovalue(name);
2644  }
2645 
2646  // the provided default value is the returned value
2647  return defaultValue;
2648 }
2649 
2650 
2651 /**
2652  * Merge a list of trapped conditions from an interpret into the
2653  * parent activation's queues.
2654  *
2655  * @param sourceConditionQueue
2656  * The interpret activations condition queue.
2657  */
2658 void RexxActivation::mergeTraps(QueueClass *sourceConditionQueue)
2659 {
2660  if (sourceConditionQueue != OREF_NULL)
2661  {
2662  // if we don't have a condition queue at this level yet, then
2663  // just inherit the interpret one
2664  if (conditionQueue == OREF_NULL)
2665  {
2666  conditionQueue = sourceConditionQueue;
2667  }
2668  else
2669  {
2670  // copy all of the items over.
2671  while (!sourceConditionQueue->isEmpty())
2672  {
2673  conditionQueue->append(sourceConditionQueue->pull());
2674  }
2675  }
2676  }
2677 }
2678 
2679 
2680 /**
2681  * Unwind a chain of interpret activations to process a SIGNAL ON
2682  * or PROPAGATE condition trap. This ensures that the SIGNAL
2683  * or PROPAGATE returns to the correct condition level
2684  *
2685  * @param child The child activity.
2686  */
2687 void RexxActivation::unwindTrap(RexxActivation *child)
2688 {
2689  // still an interpret level? Merge, and try again
2690  if (isInterpret())
2691  {
2692  parent->mergeTraps(conditionQueue);
2693  parent->unwindTrap(child);
2694  }
2695  // reached the base non-interpret level
2696  else
2697  {
2698  // pull back the settings from the child
2699  child->putSettings(settings);
2700  // unwind and process the trap
2701  throw this;
2702  }
2703 }

2705 
2706 /**
2707  * Retrieve the activation that activated this activation (whew)
2708  * with the intent of doing condition trapping.
2709  *
2710  * @return The parent activation.
2711  */
2712 ActivationBase* RexxActivation::senderActivation(RexxString *conditionName)
2713 {
2714  // get the sender from the activity
2715  ActivationBase *_sender = getPreviousStackFrame();
2716  // spin down to non-native activation
2717  while (_sender != OREF_NULL && isOfClass(NativeActivation, _sender))
2718  {
2719  // if this is a native activation that is actively trapping conditions,
2720  // then use that as the condition trap target
2721  if (_sender->willTrap(conditionName))
2722  {
2723  return _sender;
2724  }
2725  _sender = _sender->getPreviousStackFrame();
2726  }
2727  // that is our sender
2728  return _sender;
2729 }
