2731 
2732 /**
2733  * Translate and interpret a string of data as a piece
2734  * of Rexx code within the current program context.
2735  *
2736  * @param codestring The source code string.
2737  */
2738 void RexxActivation::interpret(RexxString *codestring)
2739 {
2740  // check the stack space to see if we have room.
2741  ActivityManager::currentActivity->checkStackSpace();
2742  // translate the code as if it was located here.
2743  RexxCode *newCode = code->interpret(codestring, current->getLineNumber());
2744  // create a new activation to run this code
2745  RexxActivation *newActivation = ActivityManager::newActivation(activity, this, newCode, INTERPRET);
2746  activity->pushStackFrame(newActivation);
2747  ProtectedObject r;
2748  // run this compiled code on the new activation
2749  newActivation->run(OREF_NULL, OREF_NULL, argList, argCount, OREF_NULL, r);
2750 
2751 }
2752 
2753 
2754 /**
2755  * Interpret a string of debug input.
2756  *
2757  * @param codestring The code string to interpret
2758  */
2759 void RexxActivation::debugInterpret(RexxString *codestring)
2760 {
2761  // mark that this is debug mode
2762  debugPause = true;
2763  std::exception_ptr ex; // manage delayed exception (see explanation below)
2764  try
2765  {
2766  // translate the code
2767  RexxCode *newCode = code->interpret(codestring, current->getLineNumber());
2768  // get a new activation to execute this
2769  RexxActivation *newActivation = ActivityManager::newActivation(activity, this, newCode, DEBUGPAUSE);
2770  activity->pushStackFrame(newActivation);
2771  ProtectedObject r;
2772  // go run the code
2773  newActivation->run(receiver, settings.messageName, argList, argCount, OREF_NULL, r);
2774  // turn this off when done executing
2775  debugPause = false;
2776  }
2777  catch (RexxActivation *t)
2778  {
2779  // turn this off unconditionally for any errors
2780  // if we're not the target of this throw, we've already been unwound
2781  // keep throwing this until it reaches the target activation.
2782  if (t != this)
2783  {
2784  // due to Windows 64-bit issue https://sourceforge.net/p/oorexx/bugs/1914/
2785  // reported to Microsoft and closed as "Not a Bug" in
2786  // https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/msconnect-3136060-c-extreme-stack-growth-and-stack/206155
2787  // we need to use this workaround instead of a simple "throw"
2788  ex = std::current_exception(); // delay the throw to after the catch block
2789  }
2790  else
2791  {
2792  // if we're not the current kernel holder when things return, make sure we
2793  // get the lock before we continue
2794  if (ActivityManager::currentActivity != activity)
2795  {
2796  activity->requestAccess();
2797  }
2798  }
2799  }
2800  if (ex) // if we've had a delayed throw, execute it now
2801  {
2802  std::rethrow_exception(ex);
2803  }
2804 }
2805 
2806 
2807 /**
2808  * Return a Rexx-defined "dot" variable name
2809  *
2810  * @param name The target variable name.
2811  *
2812  * @return The variable value or OREF_NULL if this is not
2813  * one of the special variables.
2814  */
2815 RexxObject * RexxActivation::rexxVariable(RexxString * name )
2816 {
2817  // .RS happens in our context, so process here.
2818  if (name->strCompare("RS"))
2819  {
2820  // if we've set the return status, return that value, otherwise
2821  // just return as the string name.
2822  if (settings.isReturnStatusSet())
2823  {
2824  return new_integer(settings.returnStatus);
2825  }
2826  else
2827  {
2828  return name->concatToCstring(".");
2829  }
2830  }
2831  // all other should be handled by the parent context
2832  if (isInterpret())
2833  {
2834  return parent->rexxVariable(name);
2835  }
2836 
2837  // .METHODS
2838  if (name->strCompare("METHODS"))
2839  {
2840  return settings.parentCode->getMethods();
2841  }
2842 
2843  // .RESOURCES
2844  if (name->strCompare("RESOURCES"))
2845  {
2846  return settings.parentCode->getResources();
2847  }
2848 
2849  // .ROUTINES
2850  else if (name->strCompare("ROUTINES"))
2851  {
2852  return settings.parentCode->getRoutines();
2853  }
2854  // .LINE
2855  else if (name->strCompare("LINE"))
2856  {
2857  return new_integer(current->getLineNumber());
2858  }
2859  // .CONTEXT
2860  else if (name->strCompare("CONTEXT"))
2861  {
2862  // retrieve the context object (potentially creating it on the first request)
2863  return getContextObject();
2864  }
2865 
2866  // not one we know about
2867  return OREF_NULL;
2868 }
2869 
2870 
2871 /**
2872  * Get the context object for this activation.
2873  *
2874  * @return The created context object.
2875  */
2876 RexxObject *RexxActivation::getContextObject()
2877 {
2878  // the context object is created on demand...much of the time, this
2879  // is not needed for an activation
2880  if (contextObject == OREF_NULL)
2881  {
2882  contextObject = new RexxContext(this);
2883  }
2884  return contextObject;
2885 }

2888 /**
2889  * Return the line context information for a context.
2890  *
2891  * @return The current execution line.
2892  */
2893 RexxObject *RexxActivation::getContextLine()
2894 {
2895  // if this is an interpret, we need to report the line number of
2896  // the context that calls the interpret.
2897  if (isInterpret())
2898  {
2899  return parent->getContextLine();
2900  }
2901  else
2902  {
2903 
2904  return new_integer(current->getLineNumber());
2905  }
2906 }

2908 
2909 /**
2910  * Return the line context information for a context.
2911  *
2912  * @return The current execution line.
2913  */
2914 size_t RexxActivation::getContextLineNumber()
2915 {
2916  // if this is an interpret, we need to report the line number of
2917  // the context that calls the interpret.
2918  // it may be the case that no current instruction is available if triggered via native code
2919  // in that case current (parent?) may be NULL (cf. TRACE.testgroup),
2920  // if so return 1 as the context line number
2921  if (isInterpret())
2922  {
2923  return (parent ? parent->getContextLineNumber() : 1);
2924  }
2925  else
2926  {
2927  return (current ? current->getLineNumber() : 1);
2928  }
2929 }

2950 /**
2951  * Attempt to call a function stored in the macrospace.
2952  *
2953  * @param target The target function name.
2954  * @param arguments The argument pointer.
2955  * @param argcount The count of arguments,
2956  * @param calltype The type of call (FUNCTION or SUBROUTINE)
2957  * @param order The macrospace order flag.
2958  * @param result The function result.
2959  *
2960  * @return true if the macrospace function was located and called.
2961  */
2962 bool RexxActivation::callMacroSpaceFunction(RexxString *target, RexxObject **arguments,
2963  size_t argcount, RexxString *calltype, int order, ProtectedObject &_result)
2964 {
2965  // the located macro search position
2966  unsigned short position;
2967  const char *macroName = target->getStringData();
2968  // did we find the one we want at the right time?
2969  if (RexxQueryMacro(macroName, &position) == 0)
2970  {
2971  // this was not found if the search order was different
2972  if (order != position)
2973  {
2974  return false;
2975  }
2976  // unflatten the code now
2977  Protected<RoutineClass> routine = getMacroCode(target);
2978 
2979  // not restoreable is a call failure
2980  if (routine == OREF_NULL)
2981  {
2982  return false;
2983  }
2984  // run as a call
2985  routine->call(activity, target, arguments, argcount, calltype, OREF_NULL, EXTERNALCALL, _result);
2986  // merge (class) definitions from macro with current settings
2987  getPackageObject()->mergeRequired(routine->getPackageObject());
2988  // we handled this
2989  return true;
2990  }
2991  return false;
2992 }

3018 
3019 /**
3020  * Main method for performing an external routine call. This
3021  * orchestrates the search order for locating an external routine.
3022  *
3023  * @param target The target function name.
3024  * @param resolvedTarget
3025  * The resolved routine object for the call (if any), which
3026  * is passed back for caching.
3027  * @param arguments The pointer to the call arguments.
3028  * @param argcount The count of arguments.
3029  * @param calltype The type of call (FUNCTION or SUBROUTINE)
3030  * @param resultObj The returned result.
3031  *
3032  * @return The function result (also returned in the resultObj protected
3033  * object reference.
3034  */
3035 RexxObject *RexxActivation::externalCall(RoutineClass *&routine, RexxString *target, RexxObject **arguments, size_t argcount,
3036  RexxString *calltype, ProtectedObject &resultObj)
3037 {
3038  // Step 1: used to be the functions directory, which has been deprecated.
3039 
3040  // Step 2: Check for a ::ROUTINE definition in the local context
3041  // If found, this also passes the result back for caching
3042  routine = settings.parentCode->findRoutine(target);
3043  if (routine != OREF_NULL)
3044  {
3045  // call and return the result
3046  routine->call(activity, target, arguments, argcount, calltype, OREF_NULL, EXTERNALCALL, resultObj);
3047  return resultObj;
3048  }
3049 
3050  // Step 2a: See if the function call exit fields this one
3051  if (!activity->callObjectFunctionExit(this, target, calltype == GlobalNames::FUNCTION, resultObj, arguments, argcount))
3052  {
3053  return resultObj;
3054  }
3055 
3056  // Step 2b: See if the function call exit fields this one
3057  if (!activity->callFunctionExit(this, target, calltype == GlobalNames::FUNCTION, resultObj, arguments, argcount))
3058  {
3059  return resultObj;
3060  }
3061 
3062  // Step 3: Perform all platform-specific searches
3063  if (SystemInterpreter::invokeExternalFunction(this, activity, target, arguments, argcount, calltype, resultObj))
3064  {
3065  return resultObj;
3066  }
3067 
3068  // Step 4: Check scripting exit, which is after most of the checks
3069  if (!activity->callScriptingExit(this, target, calltype == GlobalNames::FUNCTION, resultObj, arguments, argcount))
3070  {
3071  return resultObj;
3072  }
3073 
3074  // if it's made it through all of these steps without finding anything, we
3075  // finally have a routine non found situation
3076  reportException(Error_Routine_not_found_name, target);
3077  return OREF_NULL; // prevent compile error
3078 }
3079

3081 /**
3082  * Call an external program as a function or subroutine.
3083  *
3084  * @param target The target function name.
3085  * @param parent The name of the parent program (used for resolving extensions).
3086  * @param _arguments The arguments to the call.
3087  * @param _argcount The count of arguments for the call.
3088  * @param calltype The type of call (FUNCTION or SUBROUTINE)
3089  * @param resultObj The returned result.
3090  *
3091  * @return True if an external program was located and called. false for
3092  * any failures.
3093  */
3094 bool RexxActivation::callExternalRexx(RexxString *target, RexxObject **arguments,
3095  size_t argcount, RexxString *calltype, ProtectedObject &resultObj)
3096 {
3097  // the interpreted package is created in memory and doesn't have the original program
3098  // name source information. Forward this to the parent for processing if it is an
3099  // interpreted external call
3100  if (isInterpret())
3101  {
3102  return parent->callExternalRexx(target, arguments, argcount, calltype, resultObj);
3103  }
3104 
3105  // Get full name including path
3106  Protected<RexxString> filename = resolveProgramName(target, RESOLVE_DEFAULT);
3107  if (!filename.isNull())
3108  {
3109  // try for a saved program or translate a anew
3110 
3111  Protected<RoutineClass> routine = LanguageParser::createProgramFromFile(filename);
3112  // do we have something? return not found
3113  if (routine.isNull())
3114  {
3115  return false;
3116  }
3117  else
3118  {
3119  // run as a call
3120  routine->call(activity, target, arguments, argcount, calltype, settings.currentAddress, EXTERNALCALL, resultObj);
3121  // merge all of the public info
3122  settings.parentCode->mergeRequired(routine->getPackageObject());
3123  return true;
3124  }
3125  }
3126  // the external routine wasn't found
3127  else
3128  {
3129  return false;
3130  }
3131 }

3134 /**
3135  * Retrieve a macro image file from the macro space.
3136  *
3137  * @param macroName The name of the macro to retrieve.
3138  *
3139  * @return If available, the unflattened method image.
3140  */
3141 RoutineClass *RexxActivation::getMacroCode(RexxString *macroName)
3142 {
3143  RXSTRING macroImage;
3144  RoutineClass * macroRoutine = OREF_NULL;
3145 
3146  macroImage.strptr = NULL;
3147  const char *name = macroName->getStringData();
3148  int rc;
3149  {
3150  UnsafeBlock releaser;
3151 
3152  rc = RexxResolveMacroFunction(name, &macroImage);
3153  }
3154 
3155  if (rc == 0)
3156  {
3157  macroRoutine = RoutineClass::restore(&macroImage, macroName);
3158  // return the allocated buffer
3159  if (macroImage.strptr != NULL)
3160  {
3161  SystemInterpreter::releaseResultMemory(macroImage.strptr);
3162  }
3163  }
3164  return macroRoutine;
3165 }

3275 RexxObject * RexxActivation::internalCall(RexxString *name, RexxInstruction *target,

3283  activity->pushStackFrame(newActivation);

3290 /**
3291  * Processing a call to an internal trap subroutine.
3292  *
3293  * @param name The label name of the internal call.
3294  * @param target The target instruction for the call (the label)
3295  * @param conditionObj
3296  * The associated condition object
3297  * @param resultObj A holder for a result object
3298  *
3299  * @return Any return result
3300  */
3301 RexxObject * RexxActivation::internalCallTrap(RexxString *name, RexxInstruction *target,
3302  DirectoryClass *conditionObj, ProtectedObject &resultObj)
3303 {
3304  // protect the condition object from GC by pushing on to the expression stack.
3305  stack.push(conditionObj);
3306  // we need to set the SIGL variable for an internal call
3307  size_t lineNum = current->getLineNumber();
3308  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::SIGL, VARIABLE_SIGL, new_integer(lineNum));
3309 
3310  // create a new activation to handle this
3311  RexxActivation *newActivation = ActivityManager::newActivation(activity, this, settings.parentCode, INTERNALCALL);
3312  // set the condition object into the context that will handle the call
3313  newActivation->setConditionObj(conditionObj);
3314  activity->pushStackFrame(newActivation);
3315  // and go run this.
3316  return newActivation->run(OREF_NULL, name, (RexxObject **)&conditionObj, 1, target, resultObj);
3317 }

3320 /**
3321  * Wait for a variable in a guard expression to get updated.
3322  */
3323 void RexxActivation::guardWait()
3324 {
3325  // we need to wait without locking the variables. If we
3326  // held the lock before the wait, we reacquire it after we wake up.
3327  GuardStatus initial_state = objectScope;
3328 
3329  if (objectScope == SCOPE_RESERVED)
3330  {
3331  settings.objectVariables->release(activity);
3332  objectScope = SCOPE_RELEASED;
3333  }
3334  // wait to be woken up by an update
3335  activity->guardWait();
3336  // if we released the scope before waiting, then we need to get it
3337  // back before proceeding.
3338  if (initial_state == SCOPE_RESERVED)
3339  {
3340  settings.objectVariables->reserve(activity);
3341  objectScope = SCOPE_RESERVED;
3342  }
3343 }

3357 /**
3358  * Retrieve the current activation timestamp, retrieving a new
3359  * timestamp if this is the first call for a clause
3360  *
3361  * @return A RexxDateTime object with the full time stamp.
3362  */
3363 RexxDateTime RexxActivation::getTime()
3364 {
3365  // not a valid time stamp?
3366  if (!settings.timeStamp.valid)
3367  {
3368  // IMPORTANT: If a time call resets the elapsed time clock, we don't
3369  // clear the value out. The time needs to stay valid until the clause is
3370  // complete. The time stamp value that needs to be used for the next
3371  // elapsed time call is the timestamp that was valid at the point of the
3372  // last call, which is our current old invalid one. So, we need to grab
3373  // that value and set the elapsed time start point, then clear the flag
3374  // so that it will remain current.
3375  if (isElapsedTimerReset())
3376  {
3377  settings.elapsedTime = settings.timeStamp.getUTCBaseTime();
3378  setElapsedTimerValid();
3379  }
3380  // get a fresh time stamp
3381  SystemInterpreter::getCurrentTime(&settings.timeStamp);
3382  // got a new one
3383  settings.timeStamp.valid = true;
3384  }
3385  // return the current time
3386  return settings.timeStamp;
3387 }

3390 /**
3391  * Retrieve the current elapsed time counter start time, starting
3392  * the counter from the current time stamp if this is the first
3393  * call
3394  *
3395  * @return The elapsed time counter.
3396  */
3397 int64_t RexxActivation::getElapsed()
3398 {
3399  // no active elapsed time clock yet?
3400  if (settings.elapsedTime == 0)
3401  {
3402  settings.elapsedTime = settings.timeStamp.getUTCBaseTime();
3403  }
3404  return settings.elapsedTime;
3405 }

3418 
3419 /**
3420  * Get the random seed for the random number generator.
3421  *
3422  * @param seed The starter seed (optional)
3423  *
3424  * @return The new seed value to use for the random numbers.
3425  */
3426 uint64_t RexxActivation::getRandomSeed(RexxInteger *seed)
3427 {
3428  // if we're in an internal routine or interpret, we need to have the parent
3429  // context process this.
3430  if (isInternalLevelCall())
3431  {
3432  return parent->getRandomSeed(seed);
3433  }
3434  // do we have a seed supplied? process that, but it must be a non-negative integer.
3435  if (seed != OREF_NULL)
3436  {
3437  wholenumber_t seed_value = seed->getValue();
3438  if (seed_value < 0)
3439  {
3440  reportException(Error_Incorrect_call_nonnegative, "RANDOM", IntegerThree, seed);
3441  }
3442 
3443  // set the seed value, then randomize it a little bit.
3444  randomSeed = seed_value;
3445  // flipping all of the bits gives us a better spread. Supplied seeds tend to
3446  // be smaller numbers with lots of zero bits.
3447  randomSeed = ~randomSeed;
3448  // and scramble it a bit further.
3449  for (size_t i = 0; i < 13; i++)
3450  {
3451  randomSeed = RANDOMIZE(randomSeed);
3452  }
3453  }
3454 
3455  // randomize the seed for generating the next number
3456  randomSeed = RANDOMIZE(randomSeed);
3457  return randomSeed;
3458 }
3459 
3460 
3461 /**
3462  * Process the random function, using the current activation
3463  * seed value.
3464  *
3465  * @param randmin The lower bounds of the range
3466  * @param randmax The upper bounds of the range.
3467  * @param randseed The optional seed value.
3468  *
3469  * @return A new random number.
3470  */
3471 RexxInteger * RexxActivation::random(RexxInteger *randmin, RexxInteger *randmax, RexxInteger *randseed)
3472 {
3473  // get a new seed value
3474  uint64_t seed = getRandomSeed(randseed);
3475 
3476  wholenumber_t minimum = DefaultRandomMin;
3477  wholenumber_t maximum = DefaultRandomMax;
3478 
3479  // now process the min and max arguments
3480  if (randmin != OREF_NULL)
3481  {
3482  // no maximum value specified and no seed specified,
3483  // then the minimum is actually the max value
3484  if ((randmax == OREF_NULL) && (randseed == OREF_NULL))
3485  {
3486  maximum = randmin->getValue();
3487  }
3488  // we have a min specified, no max, but do have a seed. The minimum IS a
3489  // minimum in this situation.
3490  else if ((randmin != OREF_NULL) && (randmax == OREF_NULL) && (randseed != OREF_NULL))
3491  {
3492  minimum = randmin->getValue();
3493  }
3494  // we have both a min and a max.
3495  else
3496  {
3497  minimum = randmin->getValue();
3498  maximum = randmax->getValue();
3499  }
3500  }
3501  // no minimum, but we have a max? That is a max.
3502  else if (randmax != OREF_NULL)
3503  {
3504  maximum = randmax->getValue();
3505  }
3506 
3507  if (maximum < minimum)
3508  {
3509  reportException(Error_Incorrect_call_random, randmin, randmax);
3510  }
3511 
3512  // we have a maximum range allowed
3513  if (maximum - minimum > MaxRandomRange)
3514  {
3515  reportException(Error_Incorrect_call_random_range, randmin, randmax);
3516  }
3517 
3518  // if there is a real range involved, we need to generate a new random value
3519  if (minimum != maximum)
3520  {
3521  // this will invert the bits of the value, start from zero and
3522  // add in each bit from the random seed
3523  uint64_t work = 0;
3524  for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(uint64_t) * 8; i++)
3525  {
3526  work <<= 1; // shift working num left one
3527  // add in next seed bit value
3528  work = work | (seed & 0x01LL);
3529  seed >>= 1; // shift off the right most seed bit
3530  }
3531  // we have a random value, now adjust the returned result for the spread of the range.
3532  minimum += (wholenumber_t)(work % (uint64_t)(maximum - minimum + 1));
3533  }
3534  return new_integer(minimum);
3535 }

3541 {
3542  "*-*", // TRACE_PREFIX_CLAUSE
3543  "+++", // TRACE_PREFIX_ERROR
3544  ">>>", // TRACE_PREFIX_RESULT
3545  ">.>", // TRACE_PREFIX_DUMMY
3546  ">V>", // TRACE_PREFIX_VARIABLE
3547  ">E>", // TRACE_PREFIX_DOTVARIABLE
3548  ">L>", // TRACE_PREFIX_LITERAL
3549  ">F>", // TRACE_PREFIX_FUNCTION
3550  ">P>", // TRACE_PREFIX_PREFIX
3551  ">O>", // TRACE_PREFIX_OPERATOR
3552  ">C>", // TRACE_PREFIX_COMPOUND
3553  ">M>", // TRACE_PREFIX_MESSAGE
3554  ">A>", // TRACE_PREFIX_ARGUMENT
3555  ">=>", // TRACE_PREFIX_ASSIGNMENT
3556  ">I>", // TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION
3557  ">N>", // TRACE_PREFIX_NAMESPACE
3558  ">K>", // TRACE_PREFIX_KEYWORD
3559  ">R>", // TRACE_PREFIX_ALIAS
3560  "<I<", // TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION_EXIT

3563 // size of a line number
3564 const size_t LINENUMBER = 6;
3565 // location of the prefix field
3566 const size_t PREFIX_OFFSET = (LINENUMBER + 1);
3567 // length of the prefix field
3568 const size_t PREFIX_LENGTH = 3;
3569 // spaces per indentation amount
3570 const size_t INDENT_SPACING = 2;
3571 // over head for adding quotes
3572 const size_t QUOTES_OVERHEAD = 2;
3573 
3574 // extra space required to format a result line. This overhead is
3575 // 6 leading spaces for the line number, + 1 space + length of the
3576 // message prefix (3) + 1 space + 2 for an indent + 2 for the
3577 // quotes surrounding the value
3578 const size_t TRACE_OVERHEAD = LINENUMBER + 1 + PREFIX_LENGTH + 1 + INDENT_SPACING + QUOTES_OVERHEAD;
3579 
3580 // overhead for a traced instruction
3581 // (6 digit line number, blank,
3582 // 3 character prefix, and a blank
3583 const size_t INSTRUCTION_OVERHEAD = LINENUMBER + 1 + PREFIX_LENGTH + 1;
3584 
3585 // our maximum indentation amount for tracebacks
3586 const size_t MAX_TRACEBACK_INDENT = 20;
3587 
3588 
3589 // marker used for tagged traces to separate tag from the value
3590 const char *RexxActivation::VALUE_MARKER = " => ";
3591 // marker used for tagged traces to separate tag from the value
3592 const char *RexxActivation::ASSIGNMENT_MARKER = " <= ";
3593 
3594 
3595 /**
3596  * Trace program entry for a method or routine
3597  */
3598 void RexxActivation::traceEntry()
3599 {
3600  if (!traceEntryAllowed) return;
3601  if (traceEntryDone) return;
3602 
3603  bool earlyTraceEntry = false;
3604  {
3605  // Code analysis (allow to trace the entry before a possible lock)
3606  // If the first instruction other than expose is a non-dynamic TRACE A or TRACE I or TRACE L or TRACE R then activate the entry trace.
3607  // We are on the first instruction because traceEntryAllowed is true.
3608  RexxInstruction *instruction = current;
3609  if (instruction != OREF_NULL && instruction->getType() == KEYWORD_EXPOSE) instruction = instruction->nextInstruction;
3610  if (instruction != OREF_NULL && instruction->getType() == KEYWORD_TRACE)
3611  {
3612  RexxInstructionTrace *instructionTrace = (RexxInstructionTrace *)instruction;
3613  earlyTraceEntry = instructionTrace->nonDynamicTracingLabels() && isMethodOrRoutine();
3614  }
3615  }
3616 
3617  bool traceEntry = false;
3618  if (isInterpret())
3619  {
3620  traceEntry = tracingLabels() && parent->isMethodOrRoutine();
3621  // Next line: don't test parent->tracingLabels() because it's not yet updated with the latest value.
3622  // See RexxActivation::setTrace, there is a call of traceEntry after having updated the trace settings.
3623  // Here, we are in interpret, these trace settings will be pushed back to the parent ONLY after returning from the interpret activation.
3624  traceEntry = traceEntry && parent->traceEntryAllowed && !parent->traceEntryDone /* && parent->tracingLabels() */;
3625  }
3626  else
3627  {
3628  traceEntry = tracingLabels() && isMethodOrRoutine();
3629  }
3630 
3631  if (earlyTraceEntry || traceEntry)
3632  {
3633  // Should we use this->settings.traceEntryDone instead of this->traceEntryDone?
3634  // and let RexxActivation::run push back to the parent using parent->getSettings(settings)
3635  // when executionState == RETURNED?
3636  traceEntryDone = true; // set it now, to avoid any recursion
3637  if (isInterpret()) parent->traceEntryDone = true; // push back to the parent now, because nobody will do it for us
3638  traceEntryOrExit(TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION);
3639  if (!tracingAll())
3640  {
3641  // we pause on the label only for [::OPTIONS] TRACE LABELS
3642  pauseLabel();
3643  }
3644  }
3645 }
3646 
3647 
3648 /**
3649  * Trace program entry or exit for a method or routine
3650  */
3651 void RexxActivation::traceEntryOrExit(TracePrefix tp)
3652 {
3653  // since we're advertising the entry location up front, we want to disable
3654  // the normal trace-turn on notice. We'll get one or the other, but not
3655  // both
3656  settings.setSourceTraced(true);
3657 
3658  RexxActivation *context = this;
3659  if (isInterpret()) context = parent;
3660 
3661  ArrayClass *info = OREF_NULL;
3662 
3663  // the substitution information is different depending on whether this
3664  // is a method or a routine.
3665  if (context->isMethod())
3666  {
3667  info = new_array(context->getMessageName(), ((MethodClass *)context->executable)->getScopeName(), context->getPackage()->getProgramName());
3668  }
3669  else
3670  {
3671  info = new_array(context->getExecutable()->getName(), context->getPackage()->getProgramName());
3672  }
3673  ProtectedObject p(info);
3674 
3675  // and the message is slightly different
3676  // RexxString *message = activity->buildMessage(isRoutine() ? Message_Translations_routine_invocation : Message_Translations_method_invocation, info);
3677  RexxString *message = activity->buildMessage(context->isMethod() ? Message_Translations_method_invocation : Message_Translations_routine_invocation, info);
3678  p = message;
3679 
3680  // we build this directly into a raw character string.
3681  size_t outlength = message->getLength() + INSTRUCTION_OVERHEAD;
3682  RexxString *buffer = raw_string(outlength);
3683  ProtectedObject p2(buffer);
3684  // insert the leading blanks for the prefix area
3685  buffer->set(0, ' ', INSTRUCTION_OVERHEAD);
3686  // copy in the prefix information
3687  buffer->put(PREFIX_OFFSET, trace_prefix_table[tp], PREFIX_LENGTH);
3688  // copy the message stuff over this
3689  buffer->put(INSTRUCTION_OVERHEAD, message->getStringData(), message->getLength());
3690  // and write out the trace line
3691  processTraceInfo(activity, buffer, tp, NULLOBJECT, NULLOBJECT);
3692 }

3695 /**
3696  * Trace an intermediate or result value.
3697  *
3698  * @param value the value to trace.
3699  * @param prefix The prefix value for the item.
3700  */
3701 void RexxActivation::traceValue(RexxObject *value, TracePrefix prefix)
3702 {
3703  // nothing to trace here? Just ignore
3704  if (noTracing(value))
3705  {
3706  return;
3707  }
3708 
3709  // get the string value for the traced item (this is the "safe" string value)
3710  RexxString *stringvalue = value->stringValue();
3711  // get a string large enough for the result
3712  size_t outlength = stringvalue->getLength() + TRACE_OVERHEAD + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING;
3713  RexxString *buffer = raw_string(outlength);
3714  ProtectedObject p(buffer);
3715  buffer->set(0, ' ', TRACE_OVERHEAD + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING);
3716  buffer->put(PREFIX_OFFSET, trace_prefix_table[prefix], PREFIX_LENGTH);
3717  buffer->putChar(TRACE_OVERHEAD - 2 + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING, '\"');
3718  buffer->put(TRACE_OVERHEAD - 1 + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING, stringvalue->getStringData(), stringvalue->getLength());
3719  buffer->putChar(outlength - 1, '\"');
3720  processTraceInfo(activity, buffer, prefix, NULLOBJECT, NULLOBJECT);
3721 }

3724 /**
3725  * Trace an entry that's of the form 'tag => "value"'.
3726  *
3727  * @param prefix The trace prefix tag to use.
3728  * @param tagPrefix Any prefix string added to the tag. Use mostly for adding
3729  * the "." to traced environment variables.
3730  * @param quoteTag Indicates whether the tag should be quoted or not. Operator
3731  * names are quoted.
3732  * @param tag The tag name.
3733  * @param marker An additional string marker for the value.
3734  * @param value The associated trace value.
3735  */
3736 void RexxActivation::traceTaggedValue(TracePrefix prefix, const char *tagPrefix, bool quoteTag,
3737  RexxString *tag, const char *marker, RexxObject *value)
3738 {
3739  // the trace settings would normally require us to trace this, but there are conditions
3740  // where we just skip doing this anyway.
3741  if (noTracing(value))
3742  {
3743  return;
3744  }
3745 
3746  // get the string value from the traced object.
3747  Protected<RexxString> stringVal = value->stringValue();
3748 
3749  // now calculate the length of the traced string
3750  size_t outLength = tag->getLength() + stringVal->getLength();
3751  // these are fixed overheads
3752  outLength += TRACE_OVERHEAD + strlen(marker);
3753  // now the indent spacing
3754  outLength += settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING;
3755  // now other conditionals
3756  outLength += quoteTag ? QUOTES_OVERHEAD : 0;
3757  // this is usually null, but dot variables add a "." to the tag.
3758  outLength += tagPrefix == NULL ? 0 : strlen(tagPrefix);
3759 
3760  // now get a buffer to write this out into
3761  RexxString *buffer = raw_string(outLength);
3762  ProtectedObject p(buffer);
3763 
3764  // get a cursor for filling in the formatted data
3765  size_t dataOffset = TRACE_OVERHEAD + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING - 2;
3766  buffer->set(0, ' ', TRACE_OVERHEAD + settings.traceIndent * INDENT_SPACING);
3767  buffer->put(PREFIX_OFFSET, trace_prefix_table[prefix], PREFIX_LENGTH);
3768 
3769  // if this is a quoted tag (operators do this), add quotes before coping the tag
3770  if (quoteTag)
3771  {
3772  buffer->putChar(dataOffset, '\"');
3773  dataOffset++;
3774  }
3775  // is the tag prefixed? Add this before the name
3776  if (tagPrefix != NULL)
3777  {
3778  size_t prefixLength = strlen(tagPrefix);
3779  buffer->put(dataOffset, tagPrefix, prefixLength);
3780  dataOffset += prefixLength;
3781  }
3782 
3783  // add in the tag name
3784  buffer->put(dataOffset, tag);
3785  dataOffset += tag->getLength();
3786 
3787  // might need a closing quote.
3788  if (quoteTag)
3789  {
3790  buffer->putChar(dataOffset, '\"');
3791  dataOffset++;
3792  }
3793 
3794  // now add the data marker
3795  buffer->put(dataOffset, marker, strlen(marker));
3796  dataOffset += strlen(marker);
3797 
3798  // the leading quote around the value
3799  buffer->putChar(dataOffset, '\"');
3800  dataOffset++;
3801 
3802  // the traced value
3803  buffer->put(dataOffset, stringVal);
3804  dataOffset += stringVal->getLength();
3805 
3806  // and finally, the trailing quote
3807  buffer->putChar(dataOffset, '\"');
3808  dataOffset++;
3809  /* write out the line */
3810  processTraceInfo(activity, buffer, prefix, tag, value);
3811 }

4005 /**
4006  * Format a source line for traceback or tracing
4007  *
4008  * @param instruction
4009  * The target instruction.
4010  * @param package The package this instruction belongs to.
4011  *
4012  * @return The formatted traceback line.
4013  */
4014 RexxString *RexxActivation::formatTrace(RexxInstruction *instruction, PackageClass *package)
4015 {
4016  // nothing to do if we don't have an instruction
4017  if (instruction == OREF_NULL)
4018  {
4019  return OREF_NULL;
4020  }
4021  // get the instruction location
4022  SourceLocation location = instruction->getLocation();
4023  return package->traceBack(this, location, std::min(settings.traceIndent, MAX_TRACEBACK_INDENT), true);

4027 /**
4028  * Handle all clause boundary processing (raising of halt
4029  * conditions, turning on of external traces, and calling of halt
4030  * and trace clause boundary exits
4031  */
4032 void RexxActivation::processClauseBoundary()
4033 {
4034  // do we have any pending CALL ON conditions? Dispatch those
4035  // now.
4036  if (conditionQueue != OREF_NULL && !conditionQueue->isEmpty())
4037  {
4038  processTraps();
4039  }
4040 
4041  // test any halt exit wants to raise a halt condition.
4042  activity->callHaltTestExit(this);
4043  // check for external traces
4044  if (!activity->callTraceTestExit(this, settings.haveExternalTraceOn()))
4045  {
4046  // remember how this flipped
4047  if (settings.haveExternalTraceOn())
4048  {
4049  enableExternalTrace();
4050  }
4051  else
4052  {
4053  disableExternalTrace();
4054  }
4055  }
4056 
4057  // have a halt condition?
4058  if (settings.haveHaltCondition())
4059  {
4060  // flip this off and raise the condition
4061  // if not handled as a condition, turn into a syntax error
4062  settings.setHaltCondition(false);
4063  if (!activity->raiseCondition(GlobalNames::HALT, OREF_NULL, settings.haltDescription, OREF_NULL, OREF_NULL))
4064  {
4065  reportException(Error_Program_interrupted_condition, GlobalNames::HALT);
4066  }
4067  }
4068 
4069  // been asked to turn on tracing?
4070  if (settings.haveExternalTraceOn())
4071  {
4072  settings.setExternalTraceOn(false);
4073  enableExternalTrace();
4074  }
4075 
4076  // maybe turning tracing off?
4077  if (settings.haveExternalTraceOff())
4078  {
4079  settings.setExternalTraceOff(false);
4080  disableExternalTrace();
4081  }
4082 
4083  // now set the boundary flag based on whether we still have pending stuff for
4084  // next go around.
4085  clauseBoundary = settings.haveClauseExits() || !(conditionQueue == OREF_NULL || conditionQueue->isEmpty());
4086 }

4115 /**
4116  * Halt the activation
4117  *
4118  * @param description
4119  * The description for the halt condition (if any).
4120  *
4121  * @return true if this halt was recognized, false if there is a
4122  * previous halt condition still to be processed.
4123  */
4124 bool RexxActivation::halt(RexxString *description )
4125 {
4126  // if there's no halt condition pending, set this
4127  if (!settings.haveHaltCondition())
4128  {
4129  // store the description
4130  settings.haltDescription = description;
4131  // turn on the halt flag and also the clause boundary
4132  // flag so that this gets processed.
4133  settings.setHaltCondition(true);
4134  clauseBoundary = true;
4135  return true;
4136  }
4137  else
4138  {
4139  // we're not in a good position to process this
4140  return false;
4141  }
4142 }

4177 /**
4178  * Process an individual debug pause for an instruction
4179  *
4180  * @return true if the instruction should re-execute, false otherwise.
4181  */
4182 bool RexxActivation::doDebugPause()
4183 {
4184  // already in debug pause? just skip pausing
4185  if (debugPause)
4186  {
4187  return false;
4188  }
4189 
4190  // asked to bypass...turn this off for the next time.
4191  if (settings.isDebugBypassed())
4192  {
4193  settings.setDebugBypass(false);
4194  }
4195  // debug pauses suppressed? Reduce the count and turn debug pausing
4196  // back on for the next time.
4197  else if (settings.traceSkip > 0)
4198  {
4199  settings.traceSkip--;
4200  if (settings.traceSkip == 0)
4201  {
4202  // turn tracing back on again (this
4203  // ensures the next pause also has
4204  // the instruction traced
4205  settings.setTraceSuppressed(false);
4206  }
4207  }
4208  // normal pause
4209  else
4210  {
4211  // if we don't have real source code for this instruction, we can't pause.
4212  if (!code->isTraceable())
4213  {
4214  return false;
4215  }
4216  // first time paused?
4217  if (!settings.wasDebugPromptIssued())
4218  {
4219  // write the initial prompt and turn off for the next time.
4220  processTraceInfo(activity, Interpreter::getMessageText(Message_Translations_debug_prompt), TRACE_OUTPUT, NULLOBJECT, NULLOBJECT);
4221  settings.setDebugPromptIssued(true);
4222  }
4223  // save the next instruction in case we're asked to re-execute
4224  RexxInstruction *currentInst = next;
4225  for (;;)
4226  {
4227  RexxString *response = activity->traceInput(this);
4228  // a null line just advances
4229  if (response->getLength() == 0)
4230  {
4231  break;
4232  }
4233  // a re-execute request ("=")?
4234  // we reset the next instruction and return an indicator that
4235  // we need to re-execute. Some instructions (e.g., block instructions)
4236  // need to undo some side effects of execution.
4237  else if (response->getLength() == 1 && response->getChar(0) == '=')
4238  {
4239  next = current;
4240  return true;
4241  }
4242  else
4243  {
4244  ProtectedObject p(response);
4245  // interpret the instruction
4246  debugInterpret(response);
4247  // if we've had a flow of control change, we're done.
4248  if (currentInst != next)
4249  {
4250  break;
4251  }
4252  // the trace setting may have changed on us.
4253  else if (settings.isDebugBypassed())
4254  {
4255  // turn off the bypass setting. Is for situations where a
4256  // trace in normal code turns on debug. The debug pause is
4257  // skipped until the next instruction
4258  settings.setDebugBypass(false);
4259  break;
4260  }
4261  }
4262  }
4263  }
4264  // no re-execution needed
4265  return false;
4266 }
4267 
4268 /**
4269  * Trace an individual line of a source file
4270  *
4271  * @param clause the clause to trace.
4272  * @param prefix
4273  */
4274 void RexxActivation::traceClause(RexxInstruction *clause, TracePrefix prefix)
4275 {
4276  // we might be in a state where tracing is suppressed, or there's no source available.
4277  if (noTracing())
4278  {
4279  return;
4280  }
4281  // format the trace line
4282  RexxString *line = formatTrace(clause, code->getPackageObject());
4283  ProtectedObject p(line);
4284  // do we have a real source line we can trace, go output it.
4285  if (line != OREF_NULL)
4286  {
4287  // if we've just dropped into debug mode, we need to put out the extra context line.
4288  if (inDebug() && !settings.wasSourceTraced())
4289  {
4290  traceSourceString();
4291  }
4292  processTraceInfo(activity, line, prefix, NULLOBJECT, NULLOBJECT);
4293  }
4294 }

4297 /**
4298  * resolve an IO configuration from an address name.
4299  *
4300  * @param address The address environment name
4301  * @param localConfig
4302  * The configuration that may have been specified on an
4303  * ADDRESS instruction.
4304  *
4305  * @return The IO context created by the potential merger of local
4306  * and global IO configurations.
4307  */
4308 CommandIOContext *RexxActivation::resolveAddressIOConfig(RexxString *address, CommandIOConfiguration *localConfig)
4309 {
4310  // see if we have something globally set, merge with any
4311  // local settings that have been specified
4312  CommandIOConfiguration *globalConfig = getIOConfig(address);
4313  if (globalConfig != OREF_NULL)
4314  {
4315  return globalConfig->createIOContext(this, &stack, localConfig);
4316  }
4317  // no global, but might have a local one
4318  if (localConfig != OREF_NULL)
4319  {
4320  return localConfig->createIOContext(this, &stack, OREF_NULL);
4321  }
4322  // no configuration, nothing to do
4323  return OREF_NULL;
4324 }

4326 
4327 /**
4328  * Issue a command to a named host evironment
4329  *
4330  * @param address The target address
4331  * @param commandString
4332  * The command to issue
4333  * @param ioConfig A potential I/O redirection setup for this command.
4334  */
4335 void RexxActivation::command(RexxString *address, RexxString *commandString, CommandIOConfiguration *ioConfig)
4336 {
4337  // if we are tracing command instructions, then we need to add some
4338  // additional trace information afterward. Also, if we're tracing errors or
4339  // failures, we similarly need to know if the command has already been traced.
4340  bool instruction_traced = tracingAll() || tracingCommands();
4341  ProtectedObject condition;
4342  ProtectedObject commandResult;
4343 
4344  // we possibly have local or global IO configurations in place for
4345  Protected<CommandIOContext> ioContext = resolveAddressIOConfig(address, ioConfig);
4346 
4347 
4348  // give the command exit first pass at this.
4349  if (activity->callCommandExit(this, address, commandString, commandResult, condition))
4350  {
4351  // first check for registered command handlers. If we have a handler, then
4352  // call it. This includes the default system command handlers.
4353  CommandHandler *handler = activity->resolveCommandHandler(address);
4354  if (handler != OREF_NULL)
4355  {
4356  handler->call(activity, this, address, commandString, commandResult, condition, ioContext);
4357  }
4358  else
4359  {
4360  // No handler for this environment. Give a default return code and
4361  // raise a failure condition.
4362  commandResult = new_integer(RXSUBCOM_NOTREG); // just use the not registered return code
4363  condition = activity->createConditionObject(GlobalNames::FAILURE, commandResult, commandString, OREF_NULL, OREF_NULL);
4364  }
4365  }
4366 
4367 
4368  // now process the command result.
4369  RexxObject *rc = commandResult;
4370  DirectoryClass *conditionObj = (DirectoryClass *)(RexxObject *)condition;
4371 
4372  bool failureCondition = false; // don't have a failure condition yet
4373 
4374  ReturnStatus returnStatus = RETURN_STATUS_NORMAL;
4375  // did a handler raise a condition? We need to pull the rc value from the
4376  // condition object
4377  if (conditionObj != OREF_NULL)
4378  {
4379  RexxObject *temp = (RexxObject *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RC);
4380  if (temp == OREF_NULL)
4381  {
4382  // see if we have a result and make sure the condition object
4383  // fills this as the RC value
4384  temp = (RexxObject *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RESULT);
4385  if (temp != OREF_NULL)
4386  {
4387  conditionObj->put(temp, GlobalNames::RC);
4388  }
4389  }
4390  // replace the RC value
4391  if (temp != OREF_NULL)
4392  {
4393  rc = temp;
4394  }
4395 
4396  // now check for ERROR or FAILURE conditions
4397  RexxString *conditionName = (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::CONDITION);
4398  // check for an error or failure condition, since these get special handling
4399  if (conditionName->strCompare("FAILURE"))
4400  {
4401  // unconditionally update the RC value
4402  conditionObj->put(temp, GlobalNames::RC);
4403  // failure conditions require special handling when raising the condition
4404  // we'll need to reraise this as an ERROR condition if not trapped.
4405  failureCondition = true;
4406  // set the appropriate return status
4407  returnStatus = RETURN_STATUS_FAILURE;
4408  }
4409  if (conditionName->strCompare("ERROR"))
4410  {
4411  // unconditionally update the RC value
4412  conditionObj->put(temp, GlobalNames::RC);
4413  // set the appropriate return status
4414  returnStatus = RETURN_STATUS_ERROR;
4415  }
4416  }
4417 
4418  // a handler might not return a value, so default the return code to zero
4419  // if nothing is received.
4420  if (rc == OREF_NULL)
4421  {
4422  rc = TheFalseObject;
4423  }
4424 
4425  // if this was done during a debug pause, we don't update RC
4426  // and .RS.
4427  if (!debugPause)
4428  {
4429  // set the RC value before anything
4430  setLocalVariable(GlobalNames::RC, VARIABLE_RC, rc);
4431  // tracing command errors or fails?
4432  if ((returnStatus == RETURN_STATUS_ERROR && tracingErrors()) ||
4433  (returnStatus == RETURN_STATUS_FAILURE && (tracingFailures())))
4434  {
4435  // trace the current instruction
4436  traceClause(current, TRACE_PREFIX_CLAUSE);
4437  // then we always trace full command
4438  traceValue(commandString, TRACE_PREFIX_RESULT);
4439  // this has been traced
4440  instruction_traced = true;
4441  }
4442 
4443  wholenumber_t rcValue;
4444  // need to trace the RC info too?
4445  if (instruction_traced && rc->numberValue(rcValue) && rcValue != 0)
4446  {
4447  // this has a special RC(val) format
4448  RexxString *rc_trace = rc->stringValue();
4449  rc_trace = rc_trace->concatToCstring("RC(");
4450  rc_trace = rc_trace->concatWithCstring(")");
4451  traceValue(rc_trace, TRACE_PREFIX_ERROR);
4452  }
4453  // set the return status
4454  setReturnStatus(returnStatus);
4455 
4456  // now handle any conditions we might need to raise
4457  // these are also not raised if it's a debug pause.
4458  if (conditionObj != OREF_NULL)
4459  {
4460  // first check for an ::OPTIONS FAILURE SYNTAX override
4461  if (failureCondition && isFailureSyntaxEnabled())
4462  {
4463  // we could rework our condition object, but it's easier
4464  // to just raise a SYNTAX exception
4465  reportException(Error_Execution_failure_syntax,
4466  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::DESCRIPTION),
4467  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RC));
4468  }
4469  // next we check for an ::OPTIONS ERROR SYNTAX override
4470  if (!failureCondition && isErrorSyntaxEnabled())
4471  {
4472  // just raise a SYNTAX exception
4473  reportException(Error_Execution_error_syntax,
4474  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::DESCRIPTION),
4475  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RC));
4476  }
4477 
4478  // try to raise the condition, and if it isn't handled, we might
4479  // munge this into an ERROR condition
4480  if (!activity->raiseCondition(conditionObj))
4481  {
4482  // untrapped failure condition? Turn into an ERROR condition and
4483  // reraise
4484  if (failureCondition)
4485  {
4486  // again, first check for an ::OPTIONS ERROR SYNTAX override
4487  if (isErrorSyntaxEnabled())
4488  {
4489  // if so, just raise a SYNTAX exception
4490  reportException(Error_Execution_error_syntax,
4491  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::DESCRIPTION),
4492  (RexxString *)conditionObj->get(GlobalNames::RC));
4493  }
4494 
4495  // just change the condition name
4496  conditionObj->put(GlobalNames::ERRORNAME, GlobalNames::CONDITION);
4497  activity->raiseCondition(conditionObj);
4498  }
4499  }
4500  }
4501 
4502  // do debug pause if necessary. necessary is defined by: we are
4503  // tracing ALL or COMMANDS, OR, we are using TRACE NORMAL and a FAILURE
4504  // return code was received OR we receive an ERROR return code and
4505  // have TRACE ERROR in effect.
4506  if (instruction_traced && inDebug())
4507  {
4508  doDebugPause();
4509  }
4510  }
4511 }

4560 /**
4561  * Create the source string returned by parse source
4562  *
4563  * @return The constructed source string.
4564  */
4565 RexxString *RexxActivation::sourceString()
4566 {
4567  // if this is an interpret, have the parent context handle this.
4568  if (isInterpret())
4569  {
4570  return parent->sourceString();
4571  }
4572 
4573  // first token is a platform name
4574  const char *platform = SystemInterpreter::getPlatformName();
4575 
4576  RexxString *programName = code->getProgramName();
4577 
4578  // get a raw string we can build this into
4579  RexxString *sourceString = raw_string(strlen(platform) + settings.calltype->getLength() + programName->getLength() + 2);
4580  RexxString::StringBuilder builder(sourceString);
4581 
4582  builder.append(platform);
4583  builder.append(' ');
4584  builder.append(settings.calltype);
4585  builder.append(' ');
4586  builder.append(programName);
4587 
4588  return sourceString;
4589 
4590  // build this here.
4591 }

4617 /**
4618  * Push the new environment buffer onto the environment list.
4619  *
4620  * @param environment
4621  * The new saved environment.
4622  */
4623 void RexxActivation::pushEnvironment(RexxObject *environment)
4624 {
4625  // only process if we're at the top level.
4626  if (isTopLevelCall())
4627  {
4628  // create an environment list if this is the first request
4629  if (!environmentList)
4630  {
4631  environmentList = new_queue();
4632  }
4633  // push this on the top of the stack.
4634  environmentList->push(environment);
4635  }
4636  // interprets and internal routines pass on to the parent activation
4637  else
4638  {
4639  parent->pushEnvironment(environment);
4640  }
4641 }

4644 /**
4645  * return the top level local Environemnt
4646  *
4647  * @return Pop the top local environment and restore it.
4648  */
4649 RexxObject *RexxActivation::popEnvironment()
4650 {
4651  // only process if the top level
4652  if (isTopLevelCall())
4653  {
4654  if (environmentList)
4655  {
4656  return (RexxObject *)environmentList->pull();
4657 
4658  }
4659  else
4660  {
4661  return TheNilObject;
4662  }
4663  }
4664  else
4665  {
4666  return parent->popEnvironment();
4667  }
4668 }

4671 /**
4672  * Close any streams opened by the I/O builtin functions
4673  */
4674 void RexxActivation::closeStreams()
4675 {
4676  /* exiting a bottom level? */
4677  if (isProgramOrMethod())
4678  {
4679  StringTable *streams = settings.streams; /* get the streams directory */
4680  /* actually have a table? */
4681  if (streams != OREF_NULL)
4682  {
4683  // send each of the streams in the table a CLOSE message.
4684  for (HashContents::TableIterator iterator = streams->iterator(); iterator.isAvailable(); iterator.next())
4685  {
4686  ProtectedObject result;
4687  ((RexxObject *)iterator.value())->sendMessage(GlobalNames::CLOSE, result);
4688  }
4689  }
4690  }
4691 }

4766  *

4768  * @param index The stem variable index (if known)

4770  * @param tailCount The count of tail elements.
4771  *
4772  * @return The value of the variable.
4773  */
4774 RexxObject *RexxActivation::evaluateLocalCompoundVariable(RexxString *stemName, size_t index, RexxInternalObject **tail, size_t tailCount)
4775 {

4777

4784  traceCompound(stemName, tail, tailCount, value);
4785  }

4984 /**
4985  * Create a stack frame for exception tracebacks.
4986  *
4987  * @return A StackFrame instance for this activation.
4988  */
4989 StackFrameClass *RexxActivation::createStackFrame()
4990 {
4991  const char *type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_METHOD;
4992  ArrayClass *arguments = OREF_NULL;
4993  RexxObject *target = OREF_NULL;
4994 
4995  if (isInterpret())
4996  {
4997  type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_INTERPRET;
4998  }
4999  else if (isInternalCall())
5000  {
5001  type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_INTERNAL_CALL;
5002  arguments = getArguments();
5003  }
5004  else if (isMethod())
5005  {
5006  type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_METHOD;
5007  arguments = getArguments();
5008  target = receiver;
5009  }
5010  else if (isProgram())
5011  {
5012  type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_PROGRAM;
5013  arguments = getArguments();
5014  }
5015  else if (isRoutine())
5016  {
5017  type = StackFrameClass::FRAME_ROUTINE;
5018  arguments = getArguments();
5019  }
5020 
5021  // construct the traceback line before we allocate the stack frame object.
5022  // calling this in the constructor argument list can cause the stack frame instance
5023  // to be inadvertently reclaimed if a GC is triggered while evaluating the constructor
5024  // arguments.
5025  Protected<RexxString> traceback = getTraceBack();
5026 
5027  return new StackFrameClass(type, getMessageName(), getExecutableObject(), target, arguments, traceback, getContextLineNumber(), getIdntfr(), getContextObject());
5028 }
5029 
5030 /**
5031  * Format a more informative trace line when giving
5032  * traceback information for code when no source code is
5033  * available.
5034  *
5035  * @param packageName
5036  * The package name to use (could be "REXX" for internal code)
5037  *
5038  * @return A formatted descriptive string for the invocation.
5039  */
5040 RexxString *RexxActivation::formatSourcelessTraceLine(RexxString *packageName)
5041 {
5042  // if this is a method invocation, then we can give the method name and scope.
5043  if (isMethod())
5044  {
5045  ArrayClass *info = new_array(getMessageName(), ((MethodClass *)executable)->getScopeName(), packageName);
5046  ProtectedObject p(info);
5047 
5048  return activity->buildMessage(Message_Translations_sourceless_method_invocation, info);
5049  }
5050  else if (isRoutine())
5051  {
5052  ArrayClass *info = new_array(getMessageName(), packageName);
5053  ProtectedObject p(info);
5054 
5055  return activity->buildMessage(Message_Translations_sourceless_routine_invocation, info);
5056  }
5057  else
5058  {
5059  ArrayClass *info = new_array(packageName);
5060  ProtectedObject p(info);
5061 
5062  return activity->buildMessage(Message_Translations_sourceless_program_invocation, info);
5063  }
5064 }

5095 /**
5096  * Remove a filename from the short name lookup table
5097  *
5098  * @param fullName The fully qualified name
5099  */
5100 void RexxActivation::removeFileName(RexxString *fullName)
5101 {
5102  // remove from the direct stream table
5103  getStreams()->remove(fullName);
5104  // if we have other lookups possible, remove all of the shortcuts
5105  if (notCaseSensitive() && settings.fileNames != OREF_NULL)
5106  {
5107  RexxInternalObject *removed;
5108  do
5109  {
5110  removed = settings.fileNames->removeItem(fullName);
5111  }
5112  while (removed != OREF_NULL);
5113  }
5114 }

5119 // ---- begin TraceObject; caching class for performance reasons (if the Rexx user
5120 // should be allowed to change the class object after tracing has started, we
5121 // need to change the logic to do the findClass() each time)
5122 inline RexxClass *getRexxPackageTraceObject() // only do the findClass() once
5123 {
5124  static RexxClass *RexxPackageTraceObject = OREF_NULL;
5125  if (RexxPackageTraceObject==OREF_NULL)
5126  {
5127  RexxObject *t = OREF_NULL; // required for the findClass call
5128  RexxPackageTraceObject = TheRexxPackage->findClass(GlobalNames::TRACEOBJECT, t);
5129  }
5130  return RexxPackageTraceObject;
5131 }
5132 
5133 /** Create an instance of TraceObject and fill in trace information, depending on the
5134  * tracePrefix.
5135  *
5136  * @param traceLine a RexxString
5137  * @param tracePrefix a TracePrefix enum
5138  * @param tag a RexxString, e.g. the variable name
5139  * @param value a RexxObject
5140  * @return the created TraceObject (a StringTable)
5141  *
5142  */
5143 StringTable * RexxActivation::createTraceObject(Activity *activity, RexxActivation *activation, RexxString *traceline, TracePrefix tracePrefix, RexxString *tag, RexxObject *value)
5144 {
5145  ProtectedObject result;
5146  StringTable *traceObject = (StringTable *) getRexxPackageTraceObject()->messageSend(GlobalNames::NEW, OREF_NULL, 0, result);
5147  ProtectedObject p(traceObject);
5148 
5149  traceObject -> put(traceline, GlobalNames::TRACELINE );
5150  traceObject -> put(new_integer(activity->getInstance()->getIdntfr()), GlobalNames::INTERPRETER );
5151  traceObject -> put(new_integer(activity->getIdntfr()), GlobalNames::THREAD );
5152 
5153  traceObject -> put(new_integer(activation ? activation->getIdntfr() : 0), GlobalNames::INVOCATION);
5154 
5155  // make sure we save the stackFrame information in a StringTable
5156  Protected<StackFrameClass> stackFrame = ( activation ? activation->createStackFrame() : NULL);
5157  Protected<RexxObject> sfast = ((RexxObject *)stackFrame) ? getStackFrameAsStringTable(stackFrame) : TheNilObject;
5158  traceObject -> put(sfast, GlobalNames::STACKFRAME);
5159 
5160  // tracing a variable, create and fill in a StringTable with the variable related information
5161  if (tracePrefix == TRACE_PREFIX_VARIABLE || tracePrefix == TRACE_PREFIX_ASSIGNMENT)
5162  {
5163  Protected<StringTable> varStringTable = new_string_table();
5164  traceObject -> put(varStringTable, GlobalNames::VARIABLE);
5165  varStringTable -> put(tag, GlobalNames::NAME);
5166  varStringTable -> put(value, GlobalNames::VALUE);
5167  varStringTable -> put(tracePrefix == TRACE_PREFIX_ASSIGNMENT ? TheTrueObject : TheFalseObject, GlobalNames::ASSIGNMENT);
5168  }
5169  else if (tracePrefix == TRACE_PREFIX_INVOCATION) // tracing an invocation entry
5170  {
5171  Protected<StackFrameClass> stackFrame = activity -> generateCallerStackFrame(true);
5172  if ((RexxObject *)stackFrame)
5173  {
5174  Protected<StringTable> sfast = getStackFrameAsStringTable(stackFrame);
5175  traceObject -> put(sfast, GlobalNames::CALLERSTACKFRAME);
5176  }
5177  else
5178  {
5179  if (activity -> spawnerStackFrameInfo) // spawner's frame infos saved as a StringTable?
5180  {
5181  // allows for analyzing trace logs to identify the caller of a spawned activity
5182  traceObject -> put(activity -> spawnerStackFrameInfo, GlobalNames::CALLERSTACKFRAME);
5183  }
5184  else
5185  {
5186  traceObject -> put(TheNilObject, GlobalNames::CALLERSTACKFRAME);
5187  }
5188  }
5189  }
5190 
5191  // METHODCALL, fill in method related information
5192  if (activation && activation -> isMethod())
5193  {
5194  traceObject -> put(new_integer(activation -> getVariableDictionary()->getIdntfr()), GlobalNames::ATTRIBUTEPOOL);
5195  traceObject -> put(activation -> isGuarded() ? TheTrueObject : TheFalseObject, GlobalNames::ISGUARDED );
5196  traceObject -> put(new_integer(activation -> getReserveCount()), GlobalNames::SCOPELOCKCOUNT);
5197  traceObject -> put(activation -> isObjectScopeLocked() ? TheTrueObject : TheFalseObject, GlobalNames::HASSCOPELOCK);
5198  // although receiver can be fetched via StackFrame's target, allow speeding up for debugger, hence add it always here as well
5199  traceObject -> put(activation -> getReceiver(), GlobalNames::RECEIVER);
5200 
5201  // check result of an evaluated guard condition
5202  if (tracePrefix == TRACE_PREFIX_KEYWORD) // evaluation of the guard condition?
5203  {
5204  const char* tmpTag = tag -> getStringData();
5205  // if a guard condition got evaluated tag will be "WHEN" and value exactly "0" or "1"
5206  if (strcmp(tmpTag,"WHEN") == 0)
5207  {
5208  const char* tmpValue = value -> requestString() -> getStringData();
5209  traceObject -> put((tmpValue[0]=='0') ? TheTrueObject : TheFalseObject, GlobalNames::ISWAITING);
5210  }
5211  }
5212  }
5213 
5214  return traceObject;
5215 }
5216

5218 /** Processes trace information and outputs it.
5219  *
5220  * @param traceLine the trace line to display
5221  * @param tracePrefix the kind of trace taking place
5222  * @param tag optional RexxString, e.g. the traced variable name
5223  * @param value optional RexxObject, e.g. the traced variable value
5224  */
5225 void RexxActivation::processTraceInfo(Activity *activity, RexxString *traceLine, TracePrefix tracePrefix, RexxString *tag, RexxObject *value)
5226 {
5227  // make sure this is a real string value (likely, since we constructed it in the first place)
5228  Protected<RexxString> pline = traceLine->stringTrace();
5229  Protected<StringTable> traceObject=createTraceObject(activity, this, pline, tracePrefix, tag, value);
5230  activity->traceOutput(this, pline, traceObject);
5231 }

5238 void RexxActivation::displayUsingTraceOutput(Activity *activity, RexxString *traceLine)

5243 
5244 /** Creates a StringTable with all entries from the supplied StackFrame object.
5245  * The executable object may not be present anymore, if its reference gets used
5246  * much later, e.g. in the case that a trace log gets created and analyzed after
5247  * the activity and the executable are potentially gone out of scope. Therefore
5248  * executable related information is explicitly queried and saved in form of
5249  * strings in the string table (executable's hashId, executable's name,
5250  * executable's package's name; if excutable is a method, then its scope's hashId,
5251  * its scope's name, its scope's package).
5252  * <br>
5253  * In the case the target is available it is an ooRexx object
5254  * that will remain available as long as it gets referred to (e.g. because of
5255  * being stored in an array like this one).
5256  *
5257 
5258 using
5259 * the identityHash of the StackFrame entries EXECUTABLE and TARGET if they are not
5260 * .nil.
5261 *
5262 * @param stackFrame the StackFrame object to use, may be NULLOBJECT
5263 * @return a StringTable with all the entries of stackFrame, if available
5264 */
5265 StringTable * RexxActivation::getStackFrameAsStringTable(StackFrameClass * stackFrame)
5266 {
5267  Protected<StringTable> tmpStringTable = new_string_table();
5268  if (stackFrame != NULLOBJECT)
5269  {
5270  ProtectedObject result;
5271  // array
5272  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::ARGUMENTS , result), GlobalNames::ARGUMENTS );
5273 
5274  // strings
5275  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::INVOCATION, result), GlobalNames::INVOCATION);
5276  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::LINE , result), GlobalNames::LINE );
5277  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::NAME , result), GlobalNames::NAME );
5278  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::TRACELINE , result), GlobalNames::TRACELINE );
5279  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::TYPE , result), GlobalNames::TYPE );
5280 
5281  // objects
5282  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::EXECUTABLE, result), GlobalNames::EXECUTABLE);
5283  tmpStringTable -> put(stackFrame->sendMessage(GlobalNames::TARGET , result), GlobalNames::TARGET );
5284  }
5285  return tmpStringTable;
5286 }
